      98             : enum class CSSParseResult : int32_t {
      99             :   // Parsed something successfully:
     100             :   Ok,
     101             :   // Did not find what we were looking for, but did not consume any token:
     102             :   NotFound,
     103             :   // Unexpected token or token value, too late for UngetToken() to be enough:
     104             :   Error
     105             : };

     289             :   /**
     290             :    * Parses a CSS token stream value and invokes a callback function for each
     291             :    * variable reference that is encountered.
     292             :    *
     293             :    * @param aPropertyValue The CSS token stream value.
     294             :    * @param aFunc The callback function to invoke; its parameters are the
     295             :    *   variable name found and the aData argument passed in to this function.
     296             :    * @param aData User data to pass in to the callback.
     297             :    * @return Whether aPropertyValue could be parsed as a valid CSS token stream
     298             :    *   value (e.g., without syntactic errors in variable references).

     303             : 
     304             :   /**
     305             :    * Parses aPropertyValue as a CSS token stream value and resolves any
     306             :    * variable references using the variables in aVariables.
     307             :    *
     308             :    * @param aPropertyValue The CSS token stream value.
     309             :    * @param aVariables The set of variable values to use when resolving variable
     310             :    *   references.
     311             :    * @param aResult Out parameter that gets the resolved value.
     312             :    * @param aFirstToken Out parameter that gets the type of the first token in
     313             :    *   aResult.
     314             :    * @param aLastToken Out parameter that gets the type of the last token in
     315             :    *   aResult.
     316             :    * @return Whether aResult could be parsed successfully and variable reference
     317             :    *   substitution succeeded.
     318             :    */

     324             : 
     325             :   /**
     326             :    * Parses a string as a CSS token stream value for particular property,
     327             :    * resolving any variable references.  The parsed property value is stored
     328             :    * in the specified nsRuleData object.  If aShorthandPropertyID has a value
     329             :    * other than eCSSProperty_UNKNOWN, this is the property that will be parsed;
     330             :    * otherwise, aPropertyID will be parsed.  Either way, only aPropertyID,
     331             :    * a longhand property, will be copied over to the rule data.
     332             :    *
     333             :    * If the property cannot be parsed, it will be treated as if 'initial' or
     334             :    * 'inherit' were specified, for non-inherited and inherited properties
     335             :    * respectively.
     336             :    *
     337             :    * @param aPropertyID The ID of the longhand property whose value is to be
     338             :    *   copied to the rule data.
     339             :    * @param aShorthandPropertyID The ID of the shorthand property to be parsed.
     340             :    *   If a longhand property is to be parsed, aPropertyID is that property,
     341             :    *   and aShorthandPropertyID must be eCSSProperty_UNKNOWN.
     342             :    * @param aValue The CSS token stream value.
     343             :    * @param aVariables The set of variable values to use when resolving variable
     344             :    *   references.
     345             :    * @param aRuleData The rule data object into which parsed property value for
     346             :    *   aPropertyID will be stored.
     347             :    */

     508             :   /**
     509             :    * This is a RAII class which behaves like an "AutoRestore<>" for our parser
     510             :    * input state. When instantiated, this class saves the current parser input
     511             :    * state (in a CSSParserInputState object), and it restores the parser to
     512             :    * that state when destructed, unless "DoNotRestore()" has been called.
     513             :   */
     514             :   class MOZ_RAII nsAutoCSSParserInputStateRestorer {
     515             :     public:
     516             :       explicit nsAutoCSSParserInputStateRestorer(CSSParserImpl* aParser
     517             :                                                  MOZ_GUARD_OBJECT_NOTIFIER_PARAM)
     518             :         : mParser(aParser),
     519             :           mShouldRestore(true)
     520             :       {
     521             :         MOZ_GUARD_OBJECT_NOTIFIER_INIT;
     522             :         mParser->SaveInputState(mSavedState);
     523             :       }
     524             : 
     525             :       void DoNotRestore()
     526             :       {
     527             :         mShouldRestore = false;
     528             :       }
     529             : 
     530             :       ~nsAutoCSSParserInputStateRestorer()
     531             :       {
     532             :         if (mShouldRestore) {
     533             :           mParser->RestoreSavedInputState(mSavedState);
     534             :         }
     535             :       }
     536             : 
     537             :     private:
     538             :       MOZ_DECL_USE_GUARD_OBJECT_NOTIFIER
     539             :       CSSParserImpl* mParser;
     540             :       CSSParserInputState mSavedState;
     541             :       bool mShouldRestore;
     542             :   };
     543             : 
     544             :   /**
     545             :    * This is a RAII class which creates a temporary nsCSSScanner for the given
     546             :    * string, and reconfigures aParser to use *that* scanner instead of its
     547             :    * existing scanner, until we go out of scope.  (This allows us to rewrite
     548             :    * a portion of a stylesheet using a temporary string, and switch to parsing
     549             :    * that rewritten section, and then resume parsing the original stylesheet.)
     550             :    *
     551             :    * aParser must have a non-null nsCSSScanner (which we'll be temporarily
     552             :    * replacing) and ErrorReporter (which this class will co-opt for the
     553             :    * temporary parser). While we're in scope, we also suppress error reporting,
     554             :    * so it doesn't really matter which reporter we use. We suppress reporting
     555             :    * because this class is only used with CSS that is synthesized & didn't
     556             :    * come directly from an author, and it would be confusing if we reported
     557             :    * syntax errors for CSS that an author didn't provide.
     558             :    *
     559             :    * XXXdholbert we could also change this & report errors, if needed. Might
     560             :    * want to customize the error reporting somehow though.
     561             :    */
     562             :   class MOZ_RAII nsAutoScannerChanger {
     563             :     public:
     564             :       nsAutoScannerChanger(CSSParserImpl* aParser,
     565             :                            const nsAString& aStringToScan
     566             :                            MOZ_GUARD_OBJECT_NOTIFIER_PARAM)
     567             :         : mParser(aParser),
     568             :           mOriginalScanner(aParser->mScanner),
     569             :           mStringScanner(aStringToScan, 0),
     570             :           mParserStateRestorer(aParser),
     571             :           mErrorSuppresser(aParser)
     572             :       {
     573             :         MOZ_ASSERT(mOriginalScanner,
     574             :                    "Shouldn't use nsAutoScannerChanger unless we already "
     575             :                    "have a scanner");
     576             :         MOZ_GUARD_OBJECT_NOTIFIER_INIT;
     577             : 
     578             :         // Set & setup the new scanner:
     579             :         mParser->mScanner = &mStringScanner;
     580             :         mStringScanner.SetErrorReporter(mParser->mReporter);
     581             : 
     582             :         // We might've had push-back on our original scanner (and if we did,
     583             :         // that fact is saved via mParserStateRestorer).  But we don't have
     584             :         // push-back in mStringScanner, so clear that flag.
     585             :         mParser->mHavePushBack = false;
     586             :       }
     587             : 
     588             :       ~nsAutoScannerChanger()
     589             :       {
     590             :         // Restore original scanner. All other cleanup is done by RAII members.
     591             :         mParser->mScanner = mOriginalScanner;
     592             :       }
     593             : 
     594             :     private:
     595             :       MOZ_DECL_USE_GUARD_OBJECT_NOTIFIER
     596             :       CSSParserImpl* mParser;
     597             :       nsCSSScanner *mOriginalScanner;
     598             :       nsCSSScanner mStringScanner;
     599             :       nsAutoCSSParserInputStateRestorer mParserStateRestorer;
     600             :       nsAutoSuppressErrors mErrorSuppresser;
     601             :   };
     602             : 
     603             :   /**
     604             :    * Saves the current input state, which includes any currently pushed
     605             :    * back token, and the current position of the scanner.
     606             :    */
     607             :   void SaveInputState(CSSParserInputState& aState);
     608             :

     744             :   enum nsSelectorParsingStatus {
     745             :     // we have parsed a selector and we saw a token that cannot be
     746             :     // part of a selector:
     747             :     eSelectorParsingStatus_Done,
     748             :     // we should continue parsing the selector:
     749             :     eSelectorParsingStatus_Continue,
     750             :     // we saw an unexpected token or token value,
     751             :     // or we saw end-of-file with an unfinished selector:

     937             :   // Parse a <line-names> expression.
     938             :   // If successful, either leave aValue untouched,
     939             :   // to indicate that we parsed the empty list,
     940             :   // or set it to a eCSSUnit_List of eCSSUnit_Ident.
     941             :   //
     942             :   // To parse an optional <line-names> (ie. if not finding an open bracket
     943             :   // is considered the same as an empty list),

     961             : 
     962             :   // Assuming a [ <line-names>? ] has already been parsed,
     963             :   // parse the rest of a <track-list>.
     964             :   //
     965             :   // This exists because [ <line-names>? ] is ambiguous in the 'grid-template'
     966             :   // shorthand: it can be either the start of a <track-list> (in
     967             :   // a <'grid-template-rows'>) or of the intertwined syntax that sets both
     968             :   // grid-template-rows and grid-template-areas.
     969             :   //
     970             :   // On success, |aValue| will be a list of odd length >= 3,
     971             :   // starting with a <line-names> (which is itself a list)
     972             :   // and alternating between that and <track-size>.
     973             :   bool ParseGridTrackListWithFirstLineNames(nsCSSValue& aValue,
     974             :     const nsCSSValue& aFirstLineNames,

    1112             :   /**
    1113             :    * Parses a CSS variable value.  This could be 'initial', 'inherit', 'unset'

    1115             :    *

    1119             :    *   value parsing there was a trailing backslash before EOF that must

    1122             :    *   characters that were implied when encountering EOF and which
    1123             :    *   must be included at the end of the serialized variable value.
    1124             :    * @param aFunc A callback function to invoke when a variable reference
    1125             :    *   is encountered.  May be null.  Arguments are the variable name
    1126             :    *   and the aData argument passed in to this function.

    1169             :   // The ParseColorOpacityAndCloseParen methods below attempt to parse an
    1170             :   // optional [ separator <alpha-value> ] expression, followed by a
    1171             :   // close-parenthesis, at the end of a css color function (e.g. "rgba()" or
    1172             :   // "hsla()"). If these functions simply encounter a close-parenthesis (without
    1173             :   // any [separator <alpha-value>]), they will still succeed (i.e. return true),
    1174             :   // with outparam 'aOpacity' set to a default opacity value (fully-opaque).
    1175             :   //
    1176             :   // The range of opacity component is [0, 255], and the default opacity value
    1177             :   // is 255 (fully-opaque) for this function.

    1179             :                                       char aSeparator);

    1182             :   bool ParseColorOpacityAndCloseParen(float& aOpacity,
    1183             :                                       char aSeparator);

    1296             :   // http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-values/#custom-idents
    1297             :   // Parse an identifier that is none of:
    1298             :   // * a CSS-wide keyword
    1299             :   // * "default"
    1300             :   // * a keyword in |aExcludedKeywords|
    1301             :   // * a keyword in |aPropertyKTable|
    1302             :   //
    1303             :   // |aExcludedKeywords| is an array of nsCSSKeyword
    1304             :   // that ends with a eCSSKeyword_UNKNOWN marker.
    1305             :   //
    1306             :   // |aPropertyKTable| can be used if some of the keywords to exclude
    1307             :   // also appear in an existing nsCSSProps::KTableEntry,
    1308             :   // to avoid duplicating them.

    1425             :   // Used for @import rules
    1426             :   css::Loader* mChildLoader; // not ref counted, it owns us
    1427             : 
    1428             :   // Any sheets we may reuse when parsing an @import.
    1429             :   css::LoaderReusableStyleSheets* mReusableSheets;
    1430             : 
    1431             :   // Sheet section we're in.  This is used to enforce correct ordering of the
    1432             :   // various rule types (eg the fact that a @charset rule must come before
    1433             :   // anything else).  Note that there are checks of similar things in various
    1434             :   // places in CSSStyleSheet.cpp (e.g in insertRule, RebuildChildList).
    1435             :   enum nsCSSSection {
    1436             :     eCSSSection_Charset,
    1437             :     eCSSSection_Import,
    1438             :     eCSSSection_NameSpace,
    1439             :     eCSSSection_General
    1440             :   };
    1441             :   nsCSSSection  mSection;
    1442             : 
    1443             :   nsXMLNameSpaceMap *mNameSpaceMap;  // weak, mSheet owns it
    1444             : 
    1445             :   // After an UngetToken is done this flag is true. The next call to
    1446             :   // GetToken clears the flag.
    1447             :   bool mHavePushBack : 1;
    1448             : 
    1449             :   // True if we are in quirks mode; false in standards or almost standards mode
    1450             :   bool          mNavQuirkMode : 1;
    1451             : 
    1452             :   // True when the hashless color quirk applies.
    1453             :   bool mHashlessColorQuirk : 1;
    1454             : 
    1455             :   // True when the unitless length quirk applies.
    1456             :   bool mUnitlessLengthQuirk : 1;
    1457             : 
    1458             :   // Controls access to nonstandard style constructs that are not safe
    1459             :   // for use on the public Web but necessary in UA sheets and/or
    1460             :   // useful in user sheets.  The only values stored in this field are
    1461             :   // 0, 1, and 2; three bits are allocated to avoid issues should the
    1462             :   // enum type be signed.
    1463             :   css::SheetParsingMode mParsingMode : 3;
    1464             : 
    1465             :   // True if we are in parsing rules for the chrome.
    1466             :   bool mIsChrome : 1;
    1467             : 
    1468             :   // True if we're parsing SVG presentation attributes
    1469             :   // These attributes allow non-calc lengths to be unitless (mapping to px)
    1470             :   bool mIsSVGMode : 1;
    1471             : 
    1472             :   // True if viewport units should be allowed.
    1473             :   bool mViewportUnitsEnabled : 1;
    1474             : 
    1475             :   // This flag is set when parsing a non-box shorthand; it's used to not apply
    1476             :   // some quirks during shorthand parsing
    1477             :   bool          mParsingCompoundProperty : 1;
    1478             : 
    1479             :   // True if we are in the middle of parsing an @supports condition.
    1480             :   // This is used to avoid recording the input stream when variable references
    1481             :   // are encountered in a property declaration in the @supports condition.
    1482             :   bool mInSupportsCondition : 1;
    1483             : 
    1484             :   // True if we are somewhere within a @supports rule whose condition is
    1485             :   // false.
    1486             :   bool mInFailingSupportsRule : 1;
    1487             : 
    1488             :   // True if we will suppress all parse errors (except unexpected EOFs).
    1489             :   // This is used to prevent errors for declarations inside a failing
    1490             :   // @supports rule.
    1491             :   bool mSuppressErrors : 1;
    1492             : 
    1493             :   // True if any parsing of URL values requires a sheet principal to have
    1494             :   // been passed in the nsCSSScanner constructor.  This is usually the case.
    1495             :   // It can be set to false, for example, when we create an nsCSSParser solely
    1496             :   // to parse a property value to test it for syntactic correctness.  When
    1497             :   // false, an assertion that mSheetPrincipal is non-null is skipped.  Should
    1498             :   // not be set to false if any nsCSSValues created during parsing can escape
    1499             :   // out of the parser.
    1500             :   bool mSheetPrincipalRequired;
    1501             : 
    1502             :   // This enum helps us track whether we've unprefixed "display: -webkit-box"
    1503             :   // (treating it as "display: flex") in an earlier declaration within a series
    1504             :   // of declarations.  (This only impacts behavior if
    1505             :   // sWebkitPrefixedAliasesEnabled is true.)
    1506             :   enum WebkitBoxUnprefixState : uint8_t {
    1507             :     eNotParsingDecls, // We are *not* currently parsing a sequence of
    1508             :                       // CSS declarations. (default state)
    1509             : 
    1510             :     // The next two enum values indicate that we *are* currently parsing a
    1511             :     // sequence of declarations (in ParseDeclarations or ParseDeclarationBlock)
    1512             :     // and...
    1513             :     eHaveNotUnprefixed, // ...we have not unprefixed 'display:-webkit-box' in
    1514             :                         // this sequence of CSS declarations.
    1515             :     eHaveUnprefixed // ...we *have* unprefixed 'display:-webkit-box' earlier in
    1516             :                     // this sequence of CSS declarations.
    1517             :   };
    1518             :   WebkitBoxUnprefixState mWebkitBoxUnprefixState;
    1519             : 
    1520             :   // Stack of rule groups; used for @media and such.
    1521             :   InfallibleTArray<RefPtr<css::GroupRule> > mGroupStack;
    1522             : 
    1523             :   // During the parsing of a property (which may be a shorthand), the data
    1524             :   // are stored in |mTempData|.  (It is needed to ensure that parser
    1525             :   // errors cause the data to be ignored, and to ensure that a
    1526             :   // non-'!important' declaration does not override an '!important'
    1527             :   // one.)
    1528             :   nsCSSExpandedDataBlock mTempData;
    1529             : 
    1530             :   // All data from successfully parsed properties are placed into |mData|.
    1531             :   nsCSSExpandedDataBlock mData;
    1532             : 
    1533             : public:
    1534             :   // Used from nsCSSParser constructors and destructors

    1952           0 :     parsedOK = false;

    1954             : 
    1955           0 :   bool changed = false;
    1956           0 :   if (parsedOK) {
    1957           0 :     declaration->ExpandTo(&mData);
    1958             :     changed = mData.TransferFromBlock(mTempData, eCSSProperty_transform,
    1959             :                                       EnabledState(), false,
    1960             :                                       true, false, declaration,
    1961           0 :                                       GetDocument());
    1962           0 :     declaration->CompressFrom(&mData);
    1963             :   }

    1965           0 :   if (changed) {
    1966           0 :     aValue = *declaration->GetNormalBlock()->ValueFor(eCSSProperty_transform);
    1967             :   } else {
    1968           0 :     aValue.Reset();
    1969             :   }
    1970             : 
    1971           0 :   ReleaseScanner();
    1972             : 
    1973           0 :   return parsedOK;

    2147           0 :   InitScanner(scanner, reporter, aURI, aURI, nullptr);
    2148             : 
    2149             :   // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/embedded-content.html#parse-a-sizes-attribute
    2150           0 :   bool hitEnd = false;
    2151           0 :   do {
    2152           0 :     bool hitError = false;
    2153             :     // Parse single <media-condition> <source-size-value>
    2154             :     do {
    2155             :       nsAutoPtr<nsMediaQuery> query;
    2156             :       nsCSSValue value;
    2157             :

    2160           0 :                            &hitStop)) {
    2161             :         NS_ASSERTION(!hitStop, "should return true when hit stop");
    2162             :         hitError = true;
    2163             :         break;
    2164             :       }
    2165             : 
    2166           0 :       if (!query) {
    2167           0 :         REPORT_UNEXPECTED_EOF(PEParseSourceSizeListEOF);
    2168             :         NS_ASSERTION(hitStop,
    2169             :                      "should return hitStop or an error if returning no query");
    2170           0 :         hitError = true;
    2171           0 :         break;
    2172             :       }
    2173             : 
    2174           0 :       if (hitStop) {
    2175             :         // Empty conditions (e.g. just a bare value) should be treated as always
    2176             :         // matching (a query with no expressions fails to match, so a negated one
    2177             :         // always matches.)
    2178             :         query->SetNegated();
    2179             :       }
    2180             : 
    2181             :       // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/embedded-content.html#source-size-value

    2183             :       // confusion about what it would be relative to.

    2195             :         }

    2197             :         hitEnd = true;

    2205           0 :       OUTPUT_ERROR();

    2208             :       // Jumps to next entry of <source-size-list> which is a comma-separated list.

    2300             : 
    2301           0 :   bool success = ParseSelectorList(*aSelectorList, char16_t(0));
    2302             : 
    2303             :   // We deliberately do not call OUTPUT_ERROR here, because all our
    2304             :   // callers map a failure return to a JS exception, and if that JS
    2305             :   // exception is caught, people don't want to see parser diagnostics;
    2306             :   // see e.g. http://bugs.jquery.com/ticket/7535
    2307             :   // It would be nice to be able to save the parser diagnostics into
    2308             :   // the exception, so that if it _isn't_ caught we can report them
    2309             :   // along with the usual uncaught-exception message, but we don't
    2310             :   // have any way to do that at present; see bug 631621.
    2311           0 :   CLEAR_ERROR();
    2312           0 :   ReleaseScanner();
    2313             : 
    2314           0 :   if (success) {
    2315             :     NS_ASSERTION(*aSelectorList, "Should have list!");
    2316             :     return NS_OK;
    2317             :   }
    2318             :

    2457             : static bool
    2458           0 : SeparatorRequiredBetweenTokens(nsCSSTokenSerializationType aToken1,
    2459             :                                nsCSSTokenSerializationType aToken2)
    2460             : {
    2461             :   // The two lines marked with (*) do not correspond to entries in
    2462             :   // the table in the css-syntax spec but which we need to handle,
    2463             :   // as we treat them as whole tokens.
    2464           0 :   switch (aToken1) {
    2465             :     case eCSSTokenSerialization_Ident:
    2466             :       return aToken2 == eCSSTokenSerialization_Ident ||
    2467           0 :              aToken2 == eCSSTokenSerialization_Function ||

    2899             : bool
    2900           0 : CSSParserImpl::ResolveValueWithVariableReferences(
    2901             :                                         const CSSVariableValues* aVariables,
    2902             :                                         nsString& aResult,
    2903             :                                         nsCSSTokenSerializationType& aFirstToken,
    2904             :                                         nsCSSTokenSerializationType& aLastToken)
    2905             : {
    2906           0 :   aResult.Truncate(0);
    2907             : 
    2908             :   // Start recording before we read the first token.
    2909           0 :   mScanner->StartRecording();
    2910             : 
    2911           0 :   if (!GetToken(false)) {
    2912             :     // Value was empty since we reached EOF.
    2913           0 :     mScanner->StopRecording();
    2914           0 :     return false;
    2915             :   }
    2916             : 
    2917             :   UngetToken();

    2923             : 
    2924           0 :   mScanner->StopRecording();

    6025             :   // get isTree set here and will pass the check below that only
    6026             :   // allows functions if they are in our list of things allowed to be
    6027             :   // functions.  If it is _not_ using the function syntax, isTree will

    6029             :   // pseudo-elements are allowed to be either functions or not, as

    6496             : //
    6497             : // Parse the argument of a pseudo-class that has a selector list argument.
    6498             : // Such selector lists cannot contain combinators, but can contain
    6499             : // anything that goes between a pair of combinators.
    6500             : //
    6501             : CSSParserImpl::nsSelectorParsingStatus
    6502         155 : CSSParserImpl::ParsePseudoClassWithSelectorListArg(nsCSSSelector& aSelector,
    6503             :                                                    CSSPseudoClassType aType)
    6504             : {
    6505             :   nsAutoPtr<nsCSSSelectorList> slist;
    6506         155 :   if (! ParseSelectorList(*getter_Transfers(slist), char16_t(')'))) {
    6507             :     return eSelectorParsingStatus_Error; // our caller calls SkipUntil(')')
    6508             :   }
    6509             : 
    6510             :   // Check that none of the selectors in the list have combinators or
    6511             :   // pseudo-elements.

    6813             :   // try 'xxyyzz' without '#' prefix for compatibility with IE and Nav4x (bug 23236 and 45804)
    6814          15 :   if (mHashlessColorQuirk) {
    6815             :     // - If the string starts with 'a-f', the nsCSSScanner builds the
    6816             :     //   token as a eCSSToken_Ident and we can parse the string as a
    6817             :     //   'xxyyzz' RGB color.
    6818             :     // - If it only contains '0-9' digits, the token is a
    6819             :     //   eCSSToken_Number and it must be converted back to a 6
    6820             :     //   characters string to be parsed as a RGB color.
    6821             :     // - If it starts with '0-9' and contains any 'a-f', the token is a
    6822             :     //   eCSSToken_Dimension, the mNumber part must be converted back to
    6823             :     //   a string and the mIdent part must be appended to that string so
    6824             :     //   that the resulting string has 6 characters.
    6825             :     // Note: This is a hack for Nav compatibility.  Do not attempt to
    6826             :     // simplify it by hacking into the ncCSSScanner.  This would be very
    6827             :     // bad.

    6839             :         }
    6840             :         break;
    6841             : 
    6842             :       case eCSSToken_Dimension:

    6844           0 :           SprintfLiteral(buffer, "%06.0f", tk->mNumber);

    6846           0 :           temp.AssignWithConversion(buffer);
    6847           0 :           temp.Right(str, 6 - tk->mIdent.Length());
    6848           0 :           str.Append(tk->mIdent);
    6849             :         }
    6850             :         break;
    6851             :       default:
    6852             :         // There is a whole bunch of cases that are
    6853             :         // not handled by this switch.  Ignore them.

    7138             :       // (See special treatment below.)

    7143           0 :                (keyword == eCSSKeyword__moz_box ||
    7144           0 :                 keyword == eCSSKeyword__moz_inline_box)) {
    7145             :       // If we've seen "display: -webkit-box" (or "-webkit-inline-box") in an
    7146             :       // earlier declaration and we honored it, then we have to watch out for
    7147             :       // later "display: -moz-box" (and "-moz-inline-box") declarations; they're
    7148             :       // likely just a halfhearted attempt at compatibility, and they actually
    7149             :       // end up stomping on our emulation of the earlier -webkit-box
    7150             :       // display-value, via the CSS cascade. To prevent this problem, we treat
    7151             :       // "display: -moz-box" & "-moz-inline-box" as if they were simply a
    7152             :       // repetition of the webkit equivalent that we already parsed.
    7153             :       MOZ_ASSERT(sWebkitPrefixedAliasesEnabled,
    7154             :                  "The only way mWebkitBoxUnprefixState can be eHaveUnprefixed "
    7155             :                  "is if we're supporting webkit-prefixed aliases");

    7157           0 :         eCSSKeyword__webkit_box : eCSSKeyword__webkit_inline_box;

    7537             : // Note that this does include VARIANT_CALC, which is numeric.  This is

    7539             : // the calc() expression and clamps the result of the calculation to the

    7951           0 :         return CSSParseResult::Error;
    7952             :       }
    7953             :       return CSSParseResult::Ok;
    7954             :     }
    7955             :   }

    7957         140 :       IsCSSTokenCalcFunction(*tk)) {

    7959             :     //

    7961             :     // VARIANT_PERCENTAGE in the list of allowed types (numbers can be used as
    7962             :     // coefficients).

    8318             : 
    8319             : // flex: none | [ <'flex-grow'> <'flex-shrink'>? || <'flex-basis'> ]
    8320             : bool
    8321           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseFlex()
    8322             : {
    8323             :   // First check for inherit / initial / unset
    8324             :   nsCSSValue tmpVal;
    8325           0 :   if (ParseSingleTokenVariant(tmpVal, VARIANT_INHERIT, nullptr)) {
    8326             :     AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_grow, tmpVal);
    8327             :     AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_shrink, tmpVal);
    8328             :     AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_basis, tmpVal);
    8329           0 :     return true;
    8330             :   }
    8331             : 
    8332             :   // Next, check for 'none' == '0 0 auto'
    8333           0 :   if (ParseSingleTokenVariant(tmpVal, VARIANT_NONE, nullptr)) {
    8334           0 :     AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_grow, nsCSSValue(0.0f, eCSSUnit_Number));
    8335           0 :     AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_shrink, nsCSSValue(0.0f, eCSSUnit_Number));
    8336           0 :     AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_basis, nsCSSValue(eCSSUnit_Auto));
    8337           0 :     return true;
    8338             :   }
    8339             : 
    8340             :   // OK, try parsing our value as individual per-subproperty components:
    8341             :   //   [ <'flex-grow'> <'flex-shrink'>? || <'flex-basis'> ]
    8342             : 
    8343             :   // Each subproperty has a default value that it takes when it's omitted in a
    8344             :   // "flex" shorthand value. These default values are *only* for the shorthand
    8345             :   // syntax -- they're distinct from the subproperties' own initial values.  We
    8346             :   // start with each subproperty at its default, as if we had "flex: 1 1 0%".
    8347             :   nsCSSValue flexGrow(1.0f, eCSSUnit_Number);
    8348             :   nsCSSValue flexShrink(1.0f, eCSSUnit_Number);
    8349             :   nsCSSValue flexBasis(0.0f, eCSSUnit_Percent);
    8350             : 
    8351             :   // OVERVIEW OF PARSING STRATEGY:
    8352             :   // =============================
    8353             :   // a) Parse the first component as either flex-basis or flex-grow.
    8354             :   // b) If it wasn't flex-grow, parse the _next_ component as flex-grow.
    8355             :   // c) Now we've just parsed flex-grow -- so try parsing the next thing as
    8356             :   //    flex-shrink.
    8357             :   // d) Finally: If we didn't get flex-basis at the beginning, try to parse
    8358             :   //    it now, at the end.
    8359             :   //
    8360             :   // More details in each section below.
    8361             : 
    8362             :   uint32_t flexBasisVariantMask =
    8363           0 :     (nsCSSProps::ParserVariant(eCSSProperty_flex_basis) & ~(VARIANT_INHERIT));
    8364             : 
    8365             :   // (a) Parse first component. It can be either be a 'flex-basis' value or a
    8366             :   // 'flex-grow' value, so we use the flex-basis-specific variant mask, along
    8367             :   //  with VARIANT_NUMBER to accept 'flex-grow' values.
    8368             :   //
    8369             :   // NOTE: if we encounter unitless 0 here, we *must* interpret it as a
    8370             :   // 'flex-grow' value (a number), *not* as a 'flex-basis' value (a length).
    8371             :   // Conveniently, that's the behavior this combined variant-mask gives us --
    8372             :   // it'll treat unitless 0 as a number. The flexbox spec requires this:
    8373             :   // "a unitless zero that is not already preceded by two flex factors must be
    8374             :   //  interpreted as a flex factor.
    8375           0 :   if (ParseNonNegativeVariant(tmpVal, flexBasisVariantMask | VARIANT_NUMBER,
    8376           0 :                               nsCSSProps::kWidthKTable) != CSSParseResult::Ok) {
    8377             :     // First component was not a valid flex-basis or flex-grow value. Fail.
    8378             :     return false;
    8379             :   }
    8380             : 
    8381             :   // Record what we just parsed as either flex-basis or flex-grow:
    8382           0 :   bool wasFirstComponentFlexBasis = (tmpVal.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Number);
    8383           0 :   (wasFirstComponentFlexBasis ? flexBasis : flexGrow) = tmpVal;
    8384             : 
    8385             :   // (b) If we didn't get flex-grow yet, parse _next_ component as flex-grow.
    8386           0 :   bool doneParsing = false;
    8387           0 :   if (wasFirstComponentFlexBasis) {
    8388           0 :     if (ParseNonNegativeNumber(tmpVal)) {
    8389           0 :       flexGrow = tmpVal;
    8390             :     } else {
    8391             :       // Failed to parse anything after our flex-basis -- that's fine. We can
    8392             :       // skip the remaining parsing.
    8393             :       doneParsing = true;
    8394             :     }
    8395             :   }
    8396             : 
    8397           0 :   if (!doneParsing) {
    8398             :     // (c) OK -- the last thing we parsed was flex-grow, so look for a
    8399             :     //     flex-shrink in the next position.
    8400           0 :     if (ParseNonNegativeNumber(tmpVal)) {
    8401           0 :       flexShrink = tmpVal;
    8402             :     }
    8403             : 
    8404             :     // d) Finally: If we didn't get flex-basis at the beginning, try to parse
    8405             :     //    it now, at the end.
    8406             :     //
    8407             :     // NOTE: If we encounter unitless 0 in this final position, we'll parse it
    8408             :     // as a 'flex-basis' value.  That's OK, because we know it must have
    8409             :     // been "preceded by 2 flex factors" (justification below), which gets us
    8410             :     // out of the spec's requirement of otherwise having to treat unitless 0
    8411             :     // as a flex factor.
    8412             :     //
    8413             :     // JUSTIFICATION: How do we know that a unitless 0 here must have been
    8414             :     // preceded by 2 flex factors? Well, suppose we had a unitless 0 that
    8415             :     // was preceded by only 1 flex factor.  Then, we would have already
    8416             :     // accepted this unitless 0 as the 'flex-shrink' value, up above (since
    8417             :     // it's a valid flex-shrink value), and we'd have moved on to the next
    8418             :     // token (if any). And of course, if we instead had a unitless 0 preceded
    8419             :     // by *no* flex factors (if it were the first token), we would've already
    8420             :     // parsed it in our very first call to ParseNonNegativeVariant().  So, any
    8421             :     // unitless 0 encountered here *must* have been preceded by 2 flex factors.
    8422           0 :     if (!wasFirstComponentFlexBasis) {
    8423             :       CSSParseResult result =
    8424             :         ParseNonNegativeVariant(tmpVal, flexBasisVariantMask,
    8425           0 :                                 nsCSSProps::kWidthKTable);
    8426           0 :       if (result == CSSParseResult::Error) {
    8427             :         return false;
    8428           0 :       } else if (result == CSSParseResult::Ok) {
    8429           0 :         flexBasis = tmpVal;
    8430             :       }
    8431             :     }
    8432             :   }
    8433             : 
    8434             :   AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_grow,   flexGrow);
    8435             :   AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_shrink, flexShrink);
    8436             :   AppendValue(eCSSProperty_flex_basis,  flexBasis);
    8437             : 
    8438           0 :   return true;
    8439             : }
    8440             : 
    8441             : // flex-flow: <flex-direction> || <flex-wrap>
    8442             : bool
    8443           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseFlexFlow()
    8444             : {
    8445             :   static const nsCSSPropertyID kFlexFlowSubprops[] = {
    8446             :     eCSSProperty_flex_direction,

    8771             : bool
    8772           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseGridTrackListWithFirstLineNames(nsCSSValue& aValue,

    8776           0 :   nsCSSValueList* firstLineNamesItem = aValue.SetListValue();

    8778             : 
    8779             :   // This function is trying to parse <track-list>, which is
    8780             :   //   [ <line-names>? [ <track-size> | <repeat()> ] ]+ <line-names>?
    8781             :   // and we're already past the first "<line-names>?".
    8782             :   // If aFlags contains eExplicitTrackList then <repeat()> is disallowed.
    8783             :   //
    8784             :   // Each iteration of the following loop attempts to parse either a
    8785             :   // repeat() or a <track-size> expression, and then an (optional)
    8786             :   // <line-names> expression.
    8787             :   //
    8788             :   // The only successful exit point from this loop is the ::NotFound
    8789             :   // case after ParseGridTrackSize(); i.e. we'll greedily parse
    8790             :   // repeat()/<track-size> until we can't find one.

    8878             : // Takes ownership of |aSecond|
    8879             : static void
    8880           0 : ConcatLineNames(nsCSSValue& aFirst, nsCSSValue& aSecond)
    8881             : {
    8882           0 :   if (aSecond.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Null) {
    8883             :     // Nothing to do.
    8884             :     return;
    8885             :   }
    8886           0 :   if (aFirst.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Null) {
    8887             :     // Empty or omitted <line-names>. Replace it.
    8888           0 :     aFirst = aSecond;
    8889           0 :     return;

    8893           0 :   nsCSSValueList* source = aSecond.GetListValue();

    8895             :   // Find the end:
    8896           0 :   while (target->mNext) {
    8897             :     target = target->mNext;
    8898             :   }

    8900             :   // as it'll be destroyed when |aSecond| goes out of scope.
    8901           0 :   target->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    8902           0 :   target = target->mNext;
    8903           0 :   target->mValue = source->mValue;
    8904             :   // Move the rest of the linked list.
    8905           0 :   target->mNext = source->mNext;
    8906           0 :   source->mNext = nullptr;
    8907             : }
    8908             : 
    8909             : // Assuming the 'repeat(' function token has already been consumed,
    8910             : // parse "repeat( <positive-integer> | auto-fill | auto-fit ,"
    8911             : // (or "repeat( <positive-integer> | auto-fill ," when aForSubgrid is true)
    8912             : // and stop after the comma.  Return true when parsing succeeds,
    8913             : // with aRepetitions set to the number of repetitions and aRepeatAutoEnum set
    8914             : // to an enum value for auto-fill | auto-fit (it's not set at all when
    8915             : // <positive-integer> was parsed).
    8916             : bool
    8917           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseGridTrackRepeatIntro(bool            aForSubgrid,
    8918             :                                          int32_t*        aRepetitions,
    8919             :                                          Maybe<int32_t>* aRepeatAutoEnum)
    8920             : {
    8921           0 :   if (!GetToken(true)) {
    8922             :     return false;
    8923             :   }
    8924           0 :   if (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Ident) {
    8925           0 :     if (mToken.mIdent.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("auto-fill")) {

    8931             :       return false;
    8932             :     }

    8936           0 :           mToken.mInteger > 0)) {
    8937             :       return false;

    8940             :   } else {
    8941             :     return false;
    8942             :   }
    8943             : 
    8944           0 :   if (!ExpectSymbol(',', true)) {
    8945             :     return false;
    8946             :   }
    8947           0 :   return true;
    8948             : }
    8949             : 
    8950             : // Assuming the 'repeat(' function token has already been consumed,
    8951             : // parse the rest of
    8952             : // repeat( <positive-integer> | auto-fill | auto-fit ,
    8953             : //         [ <line-names>? <track-size> ]+ <line-names>? )
    8954             : // Append to the linked list whose end is given by |aTailPtr|,
    8955             : // and update |aTailPtr| to point to the new end of the list.
    8956             : // Note: only one <track-size> is allowed for auto-fill/fit
    8957             : bool
    8958           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseGridTrackListRepeat(nsCSSValueList** aTailPtr)
    8959             : {
    8960             :   int32_t repetitions;
    8961             :   Maybe<int32_t> repeatAutoEnum;
    8962           0 :   if (!ParseGridTrackRepeatIntro(false, &repetitions, &repeatAutoEnum)) {
    8963             :     return false;
    8964             :   }
    8965             : 
    8966             :   // Parse [ <line-names>? <track-size> ]+ <line-names>?
    8967             :   // but keep the first and last <line-names> separate
    8968             :   // because they'll need to be joined.
    8969             :   // http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-grid/#repeat-notation
    8970             :   nsCSSValue firstLineNames;
    8971             :   nsCSSValue trackSize;
    8972             :   nsCSSValue lastLineNames;
    8973             :   // Optional
    8974           0 :   if (ParseGridLineNames(firstLineNames) == CSSParseResult::Error) {
    8975             :     return false;
    8976             :   }
    8977             :   // Required
    8978           0 :   GridTrackSizeFlags flags = repeatAutoEnum.isSome()
    8979             :     ? GridTrackSizeFlags::eFixedTrackSize
    8980           0 :     : GridTrackSizeFlags::eDefaultTrackSize;
    8981           0 :   if (ParseGridTrackSize(trackSize, flags) != CSSParseResult::Ok) {
    8982             :     return false;
    8983             :   }
    8984             :   // Use nsAutoPtr to free the list in case of early return.
    8985           0 :   nsAutoPtr<nsCSSValueList> firstTrackSizeItemAuto(new nsCSSValueList);
    8986           0 :   firstTrackSizeItemAuto->mValue = trackSize;
    8987             : 
    8988           0 :   nsCSSValueList* item = firstTrackSizeItemAuto;
    8989             :   for (;;) {
    8990             :     // Optional
    8991           0 :     if (ParseGridLineNames(lastLineNames) == CSSParseResult::Error) {
    8992             :       return false;
    8993             :     }
    8994             : 
    8995           0 :     if (ExpectSymbol(')', true)) {
    8996             :       break;
    8997             :     }
    8998             : 
    8999             :     // <auto-repeat> only accepts a single track size:
    9000             :     // <line-names>? <fixed-size> <line-names>?
    9001           0 :     if (repeatAutoEnum.isSome()) {
    9002           0 :       REPORT_UNEXPECTED(PEMoreThanOneGridRepeatTrackSize);
    9003             :       return false;
    9004             :     }
    9005             : 
    9006             :     // Required
    9007           0 :     if (ParseGridTrackSize(trackSize) != CSSParseResult::Ok) {
    9008             :       return false;
    9009             :     }
    9010             : 
    9011           0 :     item->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9012           0 :     item = item->mNext;
    9013           0 :     item->mValue = lastLineNames;
    9014             :     // Do not append to this list at the next iteration.
    9015           0 :     lastLineNames.Reset();
    9016             : 
    9017           0 :     item->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9018           0 :     item = item->mNext;
    9019           0 :     item->mValue = trackSize;
    9020             :   }
    9021           0 :   nsCSSValueList* lastTrackSizeItem = item;
    9022             : 
    9023             :   // [ <line-names>? <track-size> ]+ <line-names>?  is now parsed into:
    9024             :   // * firstLineNames: the first <line-names>
    9025             :   // * a linked list of odd length >= 1, from firstTrackSizeItem
    9026             :   //   (the first <track-size>) to lastTrackSizeItem (the last),
    9027             :   //   with the <line-names> sublists in between
    9028             :   // * lastLineNames: the last <line-names>
    9029             : 
    9030           0 :   if (repeatAutoEnum.isSome()) {
    9031             :     // Instead of hooking up this list into the flat track/name list as usual,
    9032             :     // we create a pair(Int, List) where the first value is the auto-fill/fit
    9033             :     // keyword and the second is the list to repeat.  There are three items
    9034             :     // in this list, the first is the list of line names before the track size,
    9035             :     // the second item is the track size, and the last item is the list of line
    9036             :     // names after the track size.  Note that the line names are NOT merged
    9037             :     // with any line names before/after the repeat() itself.
    9038             :     nsCSSValue listValue;
    9039           0 :     nsCSSValueList* list = listValue.SetListValue();
    9040           0 :     list->mValue = firstLineNames;
    9041           0 :     list = list->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9042           0 :     list->mValue = trackSize;
    9043           0 :     list = list->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9044           0 :     list->mValue = lastLineNames;
    9045             :     nsCSSValue kwd;
    9046           0 :     kwd.SetIntValue(repeatAutoEnum.value(), eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
    9047           0 :     *aTailPtr = (*aTailPtr)->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9048           0 :     (*aTailPtr)->mValue.SetPairValue(kwd, listValue);
    9049             :     // Append an empty list since the caller expects that to represent the names
    9050             :     // that follows the repeat() function.
    9051           0 :     *aTailPtr = (*aTailPtr)->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9052           0 :     return true;
    9053             :   }
    9054             : 
    9055             :   // Join the last and first <line-names> (in that order.)
    9056             :   // For example, repeat(3, (a) 100px (b) 200px (c)) results in
    9057             :   // (a) 100px (b) 200px (c a) 100px (b) 200px (c a) 100px (b) 200px (c)
    9058             :   // This is (c a).
    9059             :   // Make deep copies: the originals will be moved.
    9060             :   nsCSSValue joinerLineNames;
    9061             :   {
    9062           0 :     nsCSSValueList* target = nullptr;
    9063           0 :     if (lastLineNames.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Null) {
    9064           0 :       target = joinerLineNames.SetListValue();

    9067           0 :         target->mValue = source->mValue;
    9068           0 :         source = source->mNext;
    9069           0 :         if (!source) {
    9070             :           break;
    9071             :         }
    9072           0 :         target->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9073           0 :         target = target->mNext;
    9074           0 :       }
    9075             :     }
    9076             : 
    9077           0 :     if (firstLineNames.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Null) {
    9078           0 :       if (target) {
    9079           0 :         target->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9080           0 :         target = target->mNext;
    9081             :       } else {
    9082           0 :         target = joinerLineNames.SetListValue();
    9083             :       }
    9084           0 :       nsCSSValueList* source = firstLineNames.GetListValue();
    9085             :       for (;;) {
    9086           0 :         target->mValue = source->mValue;
    9087           0 :         source = source->mNext;
    9088           0 :         if (!source) {
    9089             :           break;
    9090             :         }
    9091           0 :         target->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9092           0 :         target = target->mNext;
    9093           0 :       }
    9094             :     }
    9095             :   }
    9096             : 
    9097             :   // Join our first <line-names> with the one before repeat().
    9098             :   // (a) repeat(1, (b) 20px) expands to (a b) 20px
    9099           0 :   nsCSSValueList* previousItemBeforeRepeat = *aTailPtr;
    9100           0 :   ConcatLineNames(previousItemBeforeRepeat->mValue, firstLineNames);
    9101             : 
    9102             :   // Move our linked list
    9103             :   // (first to last <track-size>, with the <line-names> sublists in between).
    9104             :   // This is the first repetition.
    9105             :   NS_ASSERTION(previousItemBeforeRepeat->mNext == nullptr,
    9106             :                "Expected the end of a linked list");
    9107           0 :   previousItemBeforeRepeat->mNext = firstTrackSizeItemAuto.forget();
    9108           0 :   nsCSSValueList* firstTrackSizeItem = previousItemBeforeRepeat->mNext;
    9109           0 :   nsCSSValueList* tail = lastTrackSizeItem;
    9110             : 
    9111             :   // Repeat |repetitions - 1| more times:
    9112             :   // * the joiner <line-names>
    9113             :   // * the linked list
    9114             :   //   (first to last <track-size>, with the <line-names> sublists in between)
    9115             :   MOZ_ASSERT(repetitions > 0, "Expected positive repetitions");

    9117           0 :     tail->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9118           0 :     tail = tail->mNext;
    9119           0 :     tail->mValue = joinerLineNames;
    9120             : 
    9121           0 :     nsCSSValueList* repeatedItem = firstTrackSizeItem;
    9122             :     for (;;) {
    9123           0 :       tail->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9124           0 :       tail = tail->mNext;
    9125           0 :       tail->mValue = repeatedItem->mValue;
    9126           0 :       if (repeatedItem == lastTrackSizeItem) {
    9127             :         break;
    9128             :       }
    9129           0 :       repeatedItem = repeatedItem->mNext;
    9130             :     }
    9131           0 :   }
    9132             : 
    9133             :   // Finally, move our last <line-names>.
    9134             :   // Any <line-names> immediately after repeat() will append to it.
    9135           0 :   tail->mNext = new nsCSSValueList;
    9136           0 :   tail = tail->mNext;
    9137           0 :   tail->mValue = lastLineNames;
    9138             : 
    9139           0 :   *aTailPtr = tail;

    9400           0 :     value.SetNoneValue(); // absent means 'none'

    9604             : // Parse a <grid-line>.

   10119             : 
   10120             : // Helper for ParseLinearGradient -- returns true iff aPosition represents a
   10121             : // box-position value which was parsed with only edge keywords.
   10122             : // e.g. "left top", or "bottom", but not "left 10px"
   10123             : //
   10124             : // (NOTE: Even though callers may want to exclude explicit "center", we still
   10125             : // need to allow for _CENTER here, because omitted position-values (e.g. the
   10126             : // x-component of a value like "top") will have been parsed as being *implicit*
   10127             : // center. The correct way to disallow *explicit* center is to pass "false" for
   10128             : // ParseBoxPositionValues()'s "aAllowExplicitCenter" parameter, before you
   10129             : // call this function.)
   10130             : static bool
   10131           0 : IsBoxPositionStrictlyEdgeKeywords(nsCSSValuePair& aPosition)
   10132             : {
   10133           0 :   const nsCSSValue& xValue = aPosition.mXValue;
   10134           0 :   const nsCSSValue& yValue = aPosition.mYValue;
   10135           0 :   return (xValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated &&
   10136           0 :           (xValue.GetIntValue() & (NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_LEFT |
   10137             :                                    NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_CENTER |
   10138           0 :                                    NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_RIGHT)) &&
   10139           0 :           yValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated &&
   10140           0 :           (yValue.GetIntValue() & (NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_TOP |
   10141             :                                    NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_CENTER |
   10142           0 :                                    NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_BOTTOM)));
   10143             : }
   10144             : 
   10145             : // <gradient>
   10146             : //    : linear-gradient( <linear-gradient-line>? <color-stops> ')'

   10148             : //
   10149             : // <linear-gradient-line> : [ to [left | right] || [top | bottom] ] ,

   10357             :       // [ <shape> || <size> ]? at <position> ,

   10360           0 :         SkipUntil(')');
   10361           0 :         return false;
   10362             :       }
   10363             : 
   10364           0 :       return ParseGradientColorStops(cssGradient, aValue);
   10365             :     }
   10366             : 
   10367             :     // <color-stops> only

   10441             : bool

   10533             : // Parses the x or y component of a -webkit-gradient() <point> expression.
   10534             : // See ParseWebkitGradientPoint() documentation for more.
   10535             : bool
   10536           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseWebkitGradientPointComponent(nsCSSValue& aComponent,
   10537             :                                                  bool aIsHorizontal)
   10538             : {
   10539           0 :   if (!GetToken(true)) {
   10540             :     return false;
   10541             :   }
   10542             : 
   10543             :   // Keyword tables to use for keyword-matching
   10544             :   // (Keyword order is important; we assume the index can be multiplied by 50%
   10545             :   // to convert to a percent-valued component.)
   10546             :   static const nsCSSKeyword kHorizKeywords[] = {
   10547             :     eCSSKeyword_left,   //   0%
   10548             :     eCSSKeyword_center, //  50%
   10549             :     eCSSKeyword_right   // 100%
   10550             :   };
   10551             :   static const nsCSSKeyword kVertKeywords[] = {
   10552             :     eCSSKeyword_top,     //   0%
   10553             :     eCSSKeyword_center,  //  50%
   10554             :     eCSSKeyword_bottom   // 100%
   10555             :   };
   10556             :   static const size_t kNumKeywords = MOZ_ARRAY_LENGTH(kHorizKeywords);
   10557             :   static_assert(kNumKeywords == MOZ_ARRAY_LENGTH(kVertKeywords),
   10558             :                 "Horizontal & vertical keyword tables must have same count");
   10559             : 
   10560             :   // Try to parse the component as a number, or a percent, or a
   10561             :   // keyword-converted-to-percent.
   10562           0 :   if (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Number) {
   10563           0 :     aComponent.SetFloatValue(mToken.mNumber, eCSSUnit_Pixel);
   10564           0 :   } else if (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Percentage) {
   10565           0 :     aComponent.SetPercentValue(mToken.mNumber);
   10566           0 :   } else if (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Ident) {
   10567           0 :     nsCSSKeyword keyword = nsCSSKeywords::LookupKeyword(mToken.mIdent);
   10568           0 :     if (keyword == eCSSKeyword_UNKNOWN) {
   10569             :       return false;
   10570             :     }
   10571             :     // Choose our keyword table:
   10572           0 :     const nsCSSKeyword* kwTable = aIsHorizontal ? kHorizKeywords : kVertKeywords;

   10574           0 :     bool didAcceptKeyword = false;
   10575           0 :     for (size_t i = 0; i < kNumKeywords; i++) {
   10576           0 :       if (keyword == kwTable[i]) {
   10577             :         // 0%, 50%, or 100%:
   10578           0 :         aComponent.SetPercentValue(i * 0.5);
   10579           0 :         didAcceptKeyword = true;
   10580           0 :         break;
   10581             :       }
   10582             :     }
   10583           0 :     if (!didAcceptKeyword) {
   10584             :       return false;
   10585             :     }
   10586             :   } else {
   10587             :     // Unrecognized token type. Put it back. (It might be a closing-paren of an
   10588             :     // invalid -webkit-gradient(...) expression, and we need to be sure caller
   10589             :     // can see it & stops parsing at that point.)
   10590             :     UngetToken();
   10591           0 :     return false;
   10592             :   }
   10593             :

   10597             :              "pixel length), a percent, or a keyword (converted to percent)");
   10598             :   return true;
   10599             : }
   10600             : 
   10601             : // This function parses a "<point>" expression for -webkit-gradient(...)
   10602             : // Quoting https://www.webkit.org/blog/175/introducing-css-gradients/ :
   10603             : //   "A point is a pair of space-separated values.
   10604             : //    The syntax supports numbers, percentages or
   10605             : //    the keywords top, bottom, left and right
   10606             : //    for point values."
   10607             : //
   10608             : // Two additional notes:
   10609             : //  - WebKit also accepts the "center" keyword (not listed in the text above).
   10610             : //  - WebKit only accepts horizontal-flavored keywords (left/center/right) in
   10611             : //    the first ("x") component, and vertical-flavored keywords
   10612             : //    (top/center/bottom) in the second ("y") component. (This is different
   10613             : //    from the standard gradient syntax, which accepts both orderings, e.g.
   10614             : //    "top left" as well as "left top".)
   10615             : bool
   10616           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseWebkitGradientPoint(nsCSSValuePair& aPoint)
   10617             : {
   10618           0 :   return ParseWebkitGradientPointComponent(aPoint.mXValue, true) &&
   10619           0 :     ParseWebkitGradientPointComponent(aPoint.mYValue, false);
   10620             : }
   10621             : 
   10622             : // Parse the next token as a <number> (for a <radius> in a -webkit-gradient
   10623             : // expresison).  Returns true on success; returns false & puts back
   10624             : // whatever it parsed on failure.
   10625             : bool
   10626           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseWebkitGradientRadius(float& aRadius)
   10627             : {

   10629             :     return false;
   10630             :   }
   10631             :

   10635             :   }

   10638           0 :   return true;

   10640             : 
   10641             : // Parse one of:
   10642             : //  color-stop(number|percent, color)
   10643             : //  from(color)
   10644             : //  to(color)
   10645             : //
   10646             : // Quoting https://www.webkit.org/blog/175/introducing-css-gradients/ :
   10647             : //   A stop is a function, color-stop, that takes two arguments, the stop value
   10648             : //   (either a percentage or a number between 0 and 1.0), and a color (any
   10649             : //   valid CSS color). In addition the shorthand functions from and to are
   10650             : //   supported. These functions only require a color argument and are
   10651             : //   equivalent to color-stop(0, ...) and color-stop(1.0, ) respectively.
   10652             : bool
   10653           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseWebkitGradientColorStop(nsCSSValueGradient* aGradient)
   10654             : {
   10655             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aGradient, "null gradient");
   10656             :

   10664             :     UngetToken();

   10666             :   }

   10720             : // Comparatison function to use for sorting -webkit-gradient() stops by

   10723             : static bool

   10726           0 :   return (aStop1.mLocation.GetPercentValue() <

   10775             : 
   10776             : // Compares aStartCoord to aEndCoord, and returns true iff they share the same
   10777             : // unit (both pixel, or both percent) and aStartCoord is larger.
   10778             : static bool
   10779           0 : IsWebkitGradientCoordLarger(const nsCSSValue& aStartCoord,
   10780             :                             const nsCSSValue& aEndCoord)
   10781             : {
   10782           0 :   if (aStartCoord.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Percent &&
   10783           0 :       aEndCoord.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Percent) {
   10784           0 :     return aStartCoord.GetPercentValue() > aEndCoord.GetPercentValue();
   10785             :   }
   10786             : 
   10787           0 :   if (aStartCoord.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Pixel &&
   10788           0 :       aEndCoord.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Pixel) {
   10789           0 :     return aStartCoord.GetFloatValue() > aEndCoord.GetFloatValue();
   10790             :   }
   10791             : 
   10792             :   // We can't compare them, since their units differ. Returning false suggests
   10793             :   // that aEndCoord is larger, which is probably a decent guess anyway.
   10794             :   return false;
   10795             : }
   10796             : 
   10797             : // Finalize our internal representation of a -webkit-gradient(linear, ...)
   10798             : // expression, given the parsed points.  (The parsed color stops
   10799             : // should already be hanging off of the passed-in nsCSSValueGradient.)
   10800             : //
   10801             : // Note: linear gradients progress along a line between two points.  The
   10802             : // -webkit-gradient(linear, ...) syntax lets the author precisely specify the
   10803             : // starting and ending point. However, our internal gradient structures
   10804             : // only store one point, and the other point is implicitly its reflection
   10805             : // across the painted area's center. (The legacy -moz-linear-gradient syntax
   10806             : // also lets us store an angle.)
   10807             : //
   10808             : // In this function, we try to go from the two-point representation to an
   10809             : // equivalent or approximately-equivalent one-point representation.
   10810             : void
   10811           0 : CSSParserImpl::FinalizeLinearWebkitGradient(nsCSSValueGradient* aGradient,
   10812             :                                             const nsCSSValuePair& aStartPoint,
   10813             :                                             const nsCSSValuePair& aEndPoint)
   10814             : {
   10815             :   MOZ_ASSERT(!aGradient->mIsRadial, "passed-in gradient must be linear");
   10816             : 
   10817             :   // If the start & end points have the same Y-coordinate, then we can treat
   10818             :   // this as a horizontal gradient progressing towards the center of the left
   10819             :   // or right side.
   10820           0 :   if (aStartPoint.mYValue == aEndPoint.mYValue) {
   10821             :     aGradient->mBgPos.mYValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_CENTER,
   10822           0 :                                           eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   10823           0 :     if (IsWebkitGradientCoordLarger(aStartPoint.mXValue, aEndPoint.mXValue)) {
   10824             :       aGradient->mBgPos.mXValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_LEFT,
   10825           0 :                                             eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   10826             :     } else {
   10827             :       aGradient->mBgPos.mXValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_RIGHT,
   10828           0 :                                             eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   10829             :     }
   10830             :     return;
   10831             :   }
   10832             : 
   10833             :   // If the start & end points have the same X-coordinate, then we can treat
   10834             :   // this as a horizontal gradient progressing towards the center of the top
   10835             :   // or bottom side.
   10836           0 :   if (aStartPoint.mXValue == aEndPoint.mXValue) {
   10837             :     aGradient->mBgPos.mXValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_CENTER,
   10838           0 :                                           eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   10839           0 :     if (IsWebkitGradientCoordLarger(aStartPoint.mYValue, aEndPoint.mYValue)) {
   10840             :       aGradient->mBgPos.mYValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_TOP,
   10841           0 :                                             eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   10842             :     } else {
   10843             :       aGradient->mBgPos.mYValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_BOTTOM,
   10844           0 :                                             eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   10845             :     }
   10846             :     return;
   10847             :   }
   10848             : 
   10849             :   // OK, the gradient is angled, which means we likely can't represent it
   10850             :   // exactly in |aGradient|, without doing analysis on the two points to
   10851             :   // extract an angle (which we might not be able to do depending on the units
   10852             :   // used).  For now, we'll just do something really basic -- just use the
   10853             :   // first point as if it were the starting point in a legacy
   10854             :   // -moz-linear-gradient() expression. That way, the rendered gradient will
   10855             :   // progress from this first point, towards the center of the covered element,
   10856             :   // to a reflected end point on the far side. Note that we have to use
   10857             :   // mIsLegacySyntax=true for this to work, because standardized (non-legacy)
   10858             :   // gradients place some restrictions on the reference point [namely, that it
   10859             :   // use percent units & be on the border of the element].
   10860           0 :   aGradient->mIsLegacySyntax = true;
   10861           0 :   aGradient->mBgPos = aStartPoint;
   10862             : }
   10863             : 
   10864             : // Finalize our internal representation of a -webkit-gradient(radial, ...)
   10865             : // expression, given the parsed points & radii.  (The parsed color-stops
   10866             : // should already be hanging off of the passed-in nsCSSValueGradient).
   10867             : void
   10868           0 : CSSParserImpl::FinalizeRadialWebkitGradient(nsCSSValueGradient* aGradient,
   10869             :                                             const nsCSSValuePair& aFirstCenter,
   10870             :                                             const nsCSSValuePair& aSecondCenter,
   10871             :                                             const float aFirstRadius,
   10872             :                                             const float aSecondRadius)
   10873             : {
   10874             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aGradient->mIsRadial, "passed-in gradient must be radial");
   10875             : 
   10876             :   // NOTE: -webkit-gradient(radial, ...) has *two arbitrary circles*, with the
   10877             :   // gradient stretching between the circles' edges.  In contrast, the standard
   10878             :   // syntax (and hence our data structures) can only represent *one* circle,
   10879             :   // with the gradient going from its center to its edge.  To bridge this gap
   10880             :   // in expressiveness, we'll just see which of our two circles is smaller, and
   10881             :   // we'll treat that circle as if it were zero-sized and located at the center
   10882             :   // of the larger circle. Then, we'll be able to use the same data structures
   10883             :   // that we use for the standard radial-gradient syntax.
   10884           0 :   if (aSecondRadius >= aFirstRadius) {
   10885             :     // Second circle is larger.
   10886           0 :     aGradient->mBgPos = aSecondCenter;
   10887           0 :     aGradient->mIsExplicitSize = true;
   10888           0 :     aGradient->GetRadiusX().SetFloatValue(aSecondRadius, eCSSUnit_Pixel);
   10889           0 :     return;
   10890             :   }
   10891             : 
   10892             :   // First circle is larger, so we'll have it be the outer circle.
   10893           0 :   aGradient->mBgPos = aFirstCenter;
   10894           0 :   aGradient->mIsExplicitSize = true;
   10895           0 :   aGradient->GetRadiusX().SetFloatValue(aFirstRadius, eCSSUnit_Pixel);
   10896             : 
   10897             :   // For this to work properly (with the earlier color stops attached to the
   10898             :   // first circle), we need to also reverse the color-stop list, so that
   10899             :   // e.g. the author's "from" color is attached to the outer edge (the first
   10900             :   // circle), rather than attached to the center (the collapsed second circle).
   10901           0 :   std::reverse(aGradient->mStops.begin(), aGradient->mStops.end());
   10902             : 
   10903             :   // And now invert the stop locations:
   10904           0 :   for (nsCSSValueGradientStop& colorStop : aGradient->mStops) {
   10905           0 :     float origLocation = colorStop.mLocation.GetPercentValue();
   10906           0 :     colorStop.mLocation.SetPercentValue(1.0f - origLocation);
   10907             :   }
   10908             : }
   10909             :

   11453        3380 :   if (result) {
   11454             :     // We need to call ExpectEndProperty() to decide whether to reparse
   11455             :     // with variables.  This is needed because the property parsing may
   11456             :     // have stopped upon finding a variable (e.g., 'margin: 1px var(a)')
   11457             :     // in a way that future variable substitutions will be valid, or
   11458             :     // because it parsed everything that's possible but we still want to
   11459             :     // act as though the property contains variables even though we know
   11460             :     // the substitution will never work (e.g., for 'margin: 1px 2px 3px
   11461             :     // 4px 5px var(a)').
   11462             :     //
   11463             :     // It would be nice to find a better solution here
   11464             :     // (and for the SkipUntilOneOf below), though, that doesn't depend
   11465             :     // on using what we don't accept for doing parsing correctly.
   11466        3375 :     if (!ExpectEndProperty()) {
   11467           0 :       result = false;
   11468             :     }
   11469             :   }

   11474        3380 :      stateBeforeProperty.mToken.mIdent.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("var"));

   11821             : // Bits used in determining which background position info we have
   11822             : #define BG_CENTER  NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_CENTER
   11823             : #define BG_TOP     NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_TOP
   11824             : #define BG_BOTTOM  NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_BOTTOM
   11825             : #define BG_LEFT    NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_LEFT
   11826             : #define BG_RIGHT   NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_RIGHT
   11827             : #define BG_CTB    (BG_CENTER | BG_TOP | BG_BOTTOM)

   12207             : // Parse one item of the background shorthand property.
   12208             : bool
   12209          10 : CSSParserImpl::ParseImageLayersItem(
   12210             :   CSSParserImpl::ImageLayersShorthandParseState& aState,
   12211             :   const nsCSSPropertyID aTable[])
   12212             : {
   12213             :   // Fill in the values that the shorthand will set if we don't find
   12214             :   // other values.
   12215          10 :   aState.mImage->mValue.SetNoneValue();

   12219             : 
   12220             :   aState.mRepeat->mXValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_REPEAT,
   12221          10 :                                       eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   12222          10 :   aState.mRepeat->mYValue.Reset();
   12223             : 
   12224          10 :   RefPtr<nsCSSValue::Array> positionXArr = nsCSSValue::Array::Create(2);
   12225          20 :   RefPtr<nsCSSValue::Array> positionYArr = nsCSSValue::Array::Create(2);
   12226          10 :   aState.mPositionX->mValue.SetArrayValue(positionXArr, eCSSUnit_Array);
   12227          10 :   aState.mPositionY->mValue.SetArrayValue(positionYArr, eCSSUnit_Array);
   12228             : 
   12229          10 :   if (eCSSProperty_mask == aTable[nsStyleImageLayers::shorthand]) {
   12230           0 :     aState.mOrigin->mValue.SetEnumValue(StyleGeometryBox::BorderBox);
   12231             :   } else {
   12232          10 :     aState.mOrigin->mValue.SetEnumValue(StyleGeometryBox::PaddingBox);
   12233             :   }
   12234          20 :   positionXArr->Item(1).SetPercentValue(0.0f);
   12235          20 :   positionYArr->Item(1).SetPercentValue(0.0f);
   12236             : 
   12237          10 :   aState.mSize->mXValue.SetAutoValue();
