   12239             :   aState.mComposite->mValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_MASK_COMPOSITE_ADD,
   12240          10 :                                         eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   12241             :   aState.mMode->mValue.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_MASK_MODE_MATCH_SOURCE,
   12242          10 :                                    eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   12243          10 :   bool haveColor = false,
   12244          10 :        haveImage = false,
   12245          10 :        haveRepeat = false,
   12246          10 :        haveAttach = false,
   12247          10 :        havePositionAndSize = false,
   12248          10 :        haveOrigin = false,
   12249          10 :        haveComposite = false,
   12250          10 :        haveMode = false,
   12251          10 :        haveSomething = false;
   12252             : 
   12253          10 :   const KTableEntry* originTable = nsCSSProps::kKeywordTableTable[aTable[nsStyleImageLayers::origin]];
   12254          30 :   while (GetToken(true)) {
   12255          20 :     nsCSSTokenType tt = mToken.mType;
   12256             :     UngetToken(); // ...but we'll still cheat and use mToken
   12257          20 :     if (tt == eCSSToken_Symbol) {
   12258             :       // ExpectEndProperty only looks for symbols, and nothing else will
   12259             :       // show up as one.
   12260             :       break;
   12261             :     }
   12262             : 
   12263          10 :     if (tt == eCSSToken_Ident) {
   12264          10 :       nsCSSKeyword keyword = nsCSSKeywords::LookupKeyword(mToken.mIdent);
   12265             :       int32_t dummy;
   12266          20 :       if (keyword == eCSSKeyword_inherit ||
   12267          10 :           keyword == eCSSKeyword_initial ||
   12268          10 :           keyword == eCSSKeyword_unset) {
   12269           0 :         return false;
   12270          10 :       } else if (keyword == eCSSKeyword_none) {
   12271           0 :         if (haveImage)
   12272             :           return false;
   12273           0 :         haveImage = true;
   12274           0 :         if (ParseSingleValueProperty(aState.mImage->mValue,
   12275           0 :                                      aTable[nsStyleImageLayers::image]) !=
   12276             :             CSSParseResult::Ok) {
   12277             :           NS_NOTREACHED("should be able to parse");

   12589             : 
   12590             : /**
   12591             :  * BoxPositionMaskToCSSValue and ParseBoxPositionValues are used
   12592             :  * for parsing the CSS 2.1 background-position syntax (which has at
   12593             :  * most two values).  (Compare to the css3-background syntax which
   12594             :  * takes up to four values.)  Some current CSS specifications that
   12595             :  * use background-position-like syntax still use this old syntax.
   12596             :  **
   12597             :  * Parses two values that correspond to positions in a box.  These can be
   12598             :  * values corresponding to percentages of the box, raw offsets, or keywords
   12599             :  * like "top," "left center," etc.
   12600             :  *
   12601             :  * @param aOut The nsCSSValuePair in which to place the result.
   12602             :  * @param aAcceptsInherit If true, 'inherit', 'initial' and 'unset' are
   12603             :  *   legal values
   12604             :  * @param aAllowExplicitCenter If true, 'center' is a legal value
   12605             :  * @return Whether or not the operation succeeded.
   12606             :  */
   12607           5 : bool CSSParserImpl::ParseBoxPositionValues(nsCSSValuePair &aOut,
   12608             :                                            bool aAcceptsInherit,
   12609             :                                            bool aAllowExplicitCenter)
   12610             : {
   12611             :   // First try a percentage or a length value
   12612           5 :   nsCSSValue &xValue = aOut.mXValue,
   12613           5 :              &yValue = aOut.mYValue;
   12614             :   int32_t variantMask =
   12615           5 :     (aAcceptsInherit ? VARIANT_INHERIT : 0) | VARIANT_LP | VARIANT_CALC;
   12616           5 :   CSSParseResult result = ParseVariant(xValue, variantMask, nullptr);
   12617           5 :   if (result == CSSParseResult::Error) {
   12618             :     return false;
   12619           5 :   } else if (result == CSSParseResult::Ok) {
   12620          15 :     if (eCSSUnit_Inherit == xValue.GetUnit() ||
   12621          10 :         eCSSUnit_Initial == xValue.GetUnit() ||
   12622           5 :         eCSSUnit_Unset == xValue.GetUnit()) {  // both are inherit, initial or unset
   12623           0 :       yValue = xValue;
   12624           0 :       return true;
   12625             :     }
   12626             :     // We have one percentage/length/calc. Get the optional second
   12627             :     // percentage/length/calc/keyword.
   12628           5 :     result = ParseVariant(yValue, VARIANT_LP | VARIANT_CALC, nullptr);
   12629           5 :     if (result == CSSParseResult::Error) {
   12630             :       return false;
   12631           5 :     } else if (result == CSSParseResult::Ok) {
   12632             :       // We have two numbers
   12633             :       return true;
   12634             :     }
   12635             : 
   12636           0 :     if (ParseEnum(yValue, nsCSSProps::kImageLayerPositionKTable)) {
   12637           0 :       int32_t yVal = yValue.GetIntValue();
   12638           0 :       if (!(yVal & BG_CTB)) {
   12639             :         // The second keyword can only be 'center', 'top', or 'bottom'
   12640             :         return false;
   12641             :       }
   12642           0 :       yValue = BoxPositionMaskToCSSValue(yVal, false);
   12643           0 :       return true;
   12644             :     }
   12645             : 
   12646             :     // If only one percentage or length value is given, it sets the
   12647             :     // horizontal position only, and the vertical position will be 50%.
   12648             :     yValue.SetPercentValue(0.5f);
   12649           0 :     return true;
   12650             :   }
   12651             : 
   12652             :   // Now try keywords. We do this manually to allow for the first
   12653             :   // appearance of "center" to apply to the either the x or y
   12654             :   // position (it's ambiguous so we have to disambiguate). Each
   12655             :   // allowed keyword value is assigned it's own bit. We don't allow
   12656             :   // any duplicate keywords other than center. We try to get two
   12657             :   // keywords but it's okay if there is only one.
   12658           0 :   int32_t mask = 0;
   12659           0 :   if (ParseEnum(xValue, nsCSSProps::kImageLayerPositionKTable)) {
   12660           0 :     int32_t bit = xValue.GetIntValue();
   12661           0 :     mask |= bit;
   12662           0 :     if (ParseEnum(xValue, nsCSSProps::kImageLayerPositionKTable)) {
   12663           0 :       bit = xValue.GetIntValue();
   12664           0 :       if (mask & (bit & ~BG_CENTER)) {
   12665             :         // Only the 'center' keyword can be duplicated.
   12666             :         return false;
   12667             :       }
   12668           0 :       mask |= bit;
   12669             :     }
   12670             :     else {
   12671             :       // Only one keyword.  See if we have a length, percentage, or calc.
   12672           0 :       result = ParseVariant(yValue, VARIANT_LP | VARIANT_CALC, nullptr);
   12673           0 :       if (result == CSSParseResult::Error) {
   12674             :         return false;
   12675           0 :       } else if (result == CSSParseResult::Ok) {
   12676           0 :         if (!(mask & BG_CLR)) {
   12677             :           // The first keyword can only be 'center', 'left', or 'right'
   12678             :           return false;
   12679             :         }
   12680             : 
   12681           0 :         xValue = BoxPositionMaskToCSSValue(mask, true);
   12682           0 :         return true;
   12683             :       }
   12684             :     }
   12685             :   }
   12686             : 
   12687             :   // Check for bad input. Bad input consists of no matching keywords,
   12688             :   // or pairs of x keywords or pairs of y keywords.
   12689           0 :   if ((mask == 0) || (mask == (BG_TOP | BG_BOTTOM)) ||
   12690           0 :       (mask == (BG_LEFT | BG_RIGHT)) ||
   12691           0 :       (!aAllowExplicitCenter && (mask & BG_CENTER))) {
   12692             :     return false;
   12693             :   }
   12694             : 
   12695             :   // Create style values
   12696           0 :   xValue = BoxPositionMaskToCSSValue(mask, true);
   12697           0 :   yValue = BoxPositionMaskToCSSValue(mask, false);
   12698           0 :   return true;
   12699             : }
   12700             : 
   12701             : // Parses a CSS <position> value, for e.g. the 'background-position' property.
   12702             : // Spec reference: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-background/#ltpositiongt
   12703             : // Invariants:
   12704             : //  - Always produces a four-value array on a successful parse.
   12705             : //  - The values are: X edge, X offset, Y edge, Y offset.
   12706             : //  - Edges are always keywords or null.
   12707             : //  - A |center| edge will not have an offset.
   12708             : bool
   12709           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParsePositionValue(nsCSSValue& aOut)
   12710             : {
   12711           0 :   RefPtr<nsCSSValue::Array> value = nsCSSValue::Array::Create(4);
   12712           0 :   aOut.SetArrayValue(value, eCSSUnit_Array);
   12713             : 
   12714             :   // The following clarifies organisation of the array.
   12715           0 :   nsCSSValue &xEdge   = value->Item(0),
   12716           0 :              &xOffset = value->Item(1),
   12717           0 :              &yEdge   = value->Item(2),
   12718           0 :              &yOffset = value->Item(3);
   12719             : 
   12720             :   // Parse all the values into the array.
   12721           0 :   uint32_t valueCount = 0;
   12722           0 :   for (int32_t i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
   12723             :     CSSParseResult result =
   12724           0 :       ParseVariant(value->Item(i), VARIANT_LPCALC | VARIANT_KEYWORD,
   12725           0 :                    nsCSSProps::kImageLayerPositionKTable);
   12726           0 :     if (result == CSSParseResult::Error) {
   12727             :       return false;
   12728           0 :     } else if (result == CSSParseResult::NotFound) {
   12729             :       break;
   12730             :     }
   12731           0 :     ++valueCount;
   12732             :   }
   12733             : 
   12734           0 :   switch (valueCount) {
   12735             :     case 4:
   12736             :       // "If three or four values are given, then each <percentage> or <length>
   12737             :       // represents an offset and must be preceded by a keyword, which specifies
   12738             :       // from which edge the offset is given."
   12739           0 :       if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated != xEdge.GetUnit() ||
   12740           0 :           BG_CENTER == xEdge.GetIntValue() ||
   12741           0 :           eCSSUnit_Enumerated == xOffset.GetUnit() ||
   12742           0 :           eCSSUnit_Enumerated != yEdge.GetUnit() ||
   12743           0 :           BG_CENTER == yEdge.GetIntValue() ||
   12744             :           eCSSUnit_Enumerated == yOffset.GetUnit()) {
   12745             :         return false;
   12746             :       }
   12747             :       break;
   12748             :     case 3:
   12749             :       // "If three or four values are given, then each <percentage> or<length>
   12750             :       // represents an offset and must be preceded by a keyword, which specifies
   12751             :       // from which edge the offset is given." ... "If three values are given,
   12752             :       // the missing offset is assumed to be zero."
   12753           0 :       if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated != value->Item(1).GetUnit()) {
   12754             :         // keyword offset keyword
   12755             :         // Second value is non-keyword, thus first value must be a non-center
   12756             :         // keyword.
   12757           0 :         if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated != value->Item(0).GetUnit() ||
   12758           0 :             BG_CENTER == value->Item(0).GetIntValue()) {
   12759             :           return false;
   12760             :         }
   12761             : 
   12762             :         // Remaining value must be a keyword.
   12763           0 :         if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated != value->Item(2).GetUnit()) {
   12764             :           return false;
   12765             :         }
   12766             : 
   12767           0 :         yOffset.Reset(); // Everything else is in the correct position.
   12768           0 :       } else if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated != value->Item(2).GetUnit()) {
   12769             :         // keyword keyword offset
   12770             :         // Third value is non-keyword, thus second value must be non-center
   12771             :         // keyword.
   12772           0 :         if (BG_CENTER == value->Item(1).GetIntValue()) {
   12773             :           return false;
   12774             :         }
   12775             : 
   12776             :         // Remaining value must be a keyword.
   12777           0 :         if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated != value->Item(0).GetUnit()) {
   12778             :           return false;
   12779             :         }
   12780             : 
   12781             :         // Move the values to the correct position in the array.
   12782           0 :         value->Item(3) = value->Item(2); // yOffset
   12783           0 :         value->Item(2) = value->Item(1); // yEdge
   12784           0 :         value->Item(1).Reset(); // xOffset
   12785             :       } else {
   12786             :         return false;
   12787             :       }
   12788             :       break;
   12789             :     case 2:
   12790             :       // "If two values are given and at least one value is not a keyword, then
   12791             :       // the first value represents the horizontal position (or offset) and the
   12792             :       // second represents the vertical position (or offset)"

   12794           0 :         if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated == value->Item(1).GetUnit()) {
   12795             :           // keyword keyword
   12796           0 :           value->Item(2) = value->Item(1); // move yEdge to correct position
   12797           0 :           xOffset.Reset();
   12798           0 :           yOffset.Reset();
   12799             :         } else {
   12800             :           // keyword offset
   12801             :           // First value must represent horizontal position.
   12802           0 :           if ((BG_TOP | BG_BOTTOM) & value->Item(0).GetIntValue()) {
   12803             :             return false;
   12804             :           }
   12805           0 :           value->Item(3) = value->Item(1); // move yOffset to correct position
   12806           0 :           xOffset.Reset();
   12807           0 :           yEdge.Reset();
   12808             :         }
   12809             :       } else {
   12810           0 :         if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated == value->Item(1).GetUnit()) {
   12811             :           // offset keyword
   12812             :           // Second value must represent vertical position.
   12813           0 :           if ((BG_LEFT | BG_RIGHT) & value->Item(1).GetIntValue()) {
   12814             :             return false;
   12815             :           }
   12816           0 :           value->Item(2) = value->Item(1); // move yEdge to correct position
   12817           0 :           value->Item(1) = value->Item(0); // move xOffset to correct position
   12818           0 :           xEdge.Reset();
   12819           0 :           yOffset.Reset();
   12820             :         } else {
   12821             :           // offset offset
   12822           0 :           value->Item(3) = value->Item(1); // move yOffset to correct position
   12823           0 :           value->Item(1) = value->Item(0); // move xOffset to correct position
   12824           0 :           xEdge.Reset();
   12825           0 :           yEdge.Reset();
   12826             :         }
   12827             :       }
   12828             :       break;
   12829             :     case 1:
   12830             :       // "If only one value is specified, the second value is assumed to be
   12831             :       // center."
   12832           0 :       if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated == value->Item(0).GetUnit()) {
   12833           0 :         xOffset.Reset();
   12834             :       } else {
   12835           0 :         value->Item(1) = value->Item(0); // move xOffset to correct position
   12836           0 :         xEdge.Reset();
   12837             :       }
   12838           0 :       yEdge.SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_CENTER, eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   12839           0 :       yOffset.Reset();
   12840           0 :       break;
   12841             :     default:
   12842             :       return false;
   12843             :   }
   12844             : 
   12845             :   // For compatibility with CSS2.1 code the edges can be unspecified.
   12846             :   // Unspecified edges are recorded as nullptr.
   12847             :   NS_ASSERTION((eCSSUnit_Enumerated == xEdge.GetUnit()  ||
   12848             :                 eCSSUnit_Null       == xEdge.GetUnit()) &&
   12849             :                (eCSSUnit_Enumerated == yEdge.GetUnit()  ||
   12850             :                 eCSSUnit_Null       == yEdge.GetUnit()) &&
   12851             :                 eCSSUnit_Enumerated != xOffset.GetUnit()  &&
   12852             :                 eCSSUnit_Enumerated != yOffset.GetUnit(),
   12853             :                 "Unexpected units");
   12854             : 
   12855             :   // Keywords in first and second pairs can not both be vertical or
   12856             :   // horizontal keywords. (eg. left right, bottom top). Additionally,
   12857             :   // non-center keyword can not be duplicated (eg. left left).
   12858             :   int32_t xEdgeEnum =
   12859           0 :           xEdge.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated ? xEdge.GetIntValue() : 0;
   12860             :   int32_t yEdgeEnum =
   12861           0 :           yEdge.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated ? yEdge.GetIntValue() : 0;

   12863           0 :       (xEdgeEnum | yEdgeEnum) == (BG_TOP | BG_BOTTOM) ||
   12864           0 :       (xEdgeEnum & yEdgeEnum & ~BG_CENTER)) {
   12865             :     return false;
   12866             :   }
   12867             : 
   12868             :   // The values could be in an order that is different than expected.
   12869             :   // eg. x contains vertical information, y contains horizontal information.
   12870             :   // Swap if incorrect order.
   12871           0 :   if (xEdgeEnum & (BG_TOP | BG_BOTTOM) ||
   12872           0 :       yEdgeEnum & (BG_LEFT | BG_RIGHT)) {
   12873           0 :     nsCSSValue swapEdge = xEdge;
   12874           0 :     nsCSSValue swapOffset = xOffset;
   12875           0 :     xEdge = yEdge;
   12876           0 :     xOffset = yOffset;
   12877           0 :     yEdge = swapEdge;
   12878           0 :     yOffset = swapOffset;
   12879             :   }
   12880             : 
   12881           0 :   return true;
   12882             : }

   12884             : static void
   12885           0 : AdjustEdgeOffsetPairForBasicShape(nsCSSValue& aEdge,

   12925             : 
   12926             : // https://drafts.csswg.org/css-shapes/#basic-shape-serialization
   12927             : // We set values to defaults while parsing for basic shapes
   12928             : // Invariants:
   12929             : //  - Always produces a four-value array on a successful parse.
   12930             : //  - The values are: X edge, X offset, Y edge, Y offset
   12931             : //  - Edges are always keywords (not including center)
   12932             : //  - Offsets are nonnull
   12933             : //  - Percentage offsets have keywords folded into them,
   12934             : //    so "bottom 40%" or "right 20%" will not exist.
   12935             : bool
   12936           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParsePositionValueForBasicShape(nsCSSValue& aOut)
   12937             : {
   12938           0 :   if (!ParsePositionValue(aOut)) {
   12939             :     return false;
   12940             :   }
   12941           0 :   nsCSSValue::Array* value = aOut.GetArrayValue();

   12943           0 :   nsCSSValue& xOffset = value->Item(1);
   12944           0 :   nsCSSValue& yEdge   = value->Item(2);
   12945           0 :   nsCSSValue& yOffset = value->Item(3);
   12946             :   // A keyword edge + percent offset pair can be contracted
   12947             :   // into the percentage with the default value in the edge.
   12948             :   // Offset lengths which are 0 can also be rewritten as 0%
   12949             :   AdjustEdgeOffsetPairForBasicShape(xEdge, xOffset,
   12950           0 :                                     NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_LEFT);

   12952           0 :                                     NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_TOP);
   12953           0 :   return true;
   12954             : }

   13060             : /**
   13061             :  * Parses two values that correspond to lengths for the background-size
   13062             :  * property.  These can be one or two lengths (or the 'auto' keyword) or
   13063             :  * percentages corresponding to the element's dimensions or the single keywords
   13064             :  * 'contain' or 'cover'.  'initial', 'inherit' and 'unset' must be handled by
   13065             :  * the caller if desired.
   13066             :  *
   13067             :  * @param aOut The nsCSSValuePair in which to place the result.
   13068             :  * @return Whether or not the operation succeeded.
   13069             :  */
   13070             : #define BG_SIZE_VARIANT (VARIANT_LP | VARIANT_AUTO | VARIANT_CALC)
   13071           0 : bool CSSParserImpl::ParseImageLayerSizeValues(nsCSSValuePair &aOut)
   13072             : {
   13073             :   // First try a percentage or a length value
   13074           0 :   nsCSSValue &xValue = aOut.mXValue,
   13075           0 :              &yValue = aOut.mYValue;
   13076             :   CSSParseResult result =
   13077           0 :     ParseNonNegativeVariant(xValue, BG_SIZE_VARIANT, nullptr);
   13078           0 :   if (result == CSSParseResult::Error) {
   13079             :     return false;
   13080           0 :   } else if (result == CSSParseResult::Ok) {
   13081             :     // We have one percentage/length/calc/auto. Get the optional second
   13082             :     // percentage/length/calc/keyword.
   13083           0 :     result = ParseNonNegativeVariant(yValue, BG_SIZE_VARIANT, nullptr);
   13084           0 :     if (result == CSSParseResult::Error) {
   13085             :       return false;
   13086           0 :     } else if (result == CSSParseResult::Ok) {
   13087             :       // We have a second percentage/length/calc/auto.
   13088             :       return true;
   13089             :     }
   13090             : 
   13091             :     // If only one percentage or length value is given, it sets the
   13092             :     // horizontal size only, and the vertical size will be as if by 'auto'.
   13093           0 :     yValue.SetAutoValue();
   13094           0 :     return true;
   13095             :   }
   13096             : 
   13097             :   // Now address 'contain' and 'cover'.
   13098           0 :   if (!ParseEnum(xValue, nsCSSProps::kImageLayerSizeKTable))
   13099             :     return false;
   13100           0 :   yValue.Reset();
   13101           0 :   return true;

   13158           0 :     *aConsumedTokens = true;

   13164             :     // are done.

   13166           0 :     return true;

   13179           0 :       *aConsumedTokens = false;

   13513             : 
   13514             : // Parse the top level of a calc() expression.
   13515             : bool
   13516           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseCalc(nsCSSValue &aValue, uint32_t aVariantMask)
   13517             : {
   13518             :   // Parsing calc expressions requires, in a number of cases, looking
   13519             :   // for a token that is *either* a value of the property or a number.
   13520             :   // This can be done without lookahead when we assume that the property
   13521             :   // values cannot themselves be numbers.
   13522             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aVariantMask != 0, "unexpected variant mask");
   13523             :   MOZ_ASSERT(!(aVariantMask & VARIANT_LPN) != !(aVariantMask & VARIANT_INTEGER),
   13524             :              "variant mask must intersect with exactly one of VARIANT_LPN "
   13525             :              "or VARIANT_INTEGER");
   13526             : 
   13527           0 :   bool oldUnitlessLengthQuirk = mUnitlessLengthQuirk;
   13528           0 :   mUnitlessLengthQuirk = false;
   13529             : 
   13530             :   // One-iteration loop so we can break to the error-handling case.
   13531             :   do {
   13532             :     // The toplevel of a calc() is always an nsCSSValue::Array of length 1.
   13533           0 :     RefPtr<nsCSSValue::Array> arr = nsCSSValue::Array::Create(1);
   13534             : 
   13535           0 :     if (!ParseCalcAdditiveExpression(arr->Item(0), aVariantMask))
   13536             :       break;
   13537             : 
   13538           0 :     if (!ExpectSymbol(')', true))
   13539             :       break;
   13540             : 
   13541           0 :     aValue.SetArrayValue(arr, eCSSUnit_Calc);
   13542           0 :     mUnitlessLengthQuirk = oldUnitlessLengthQuirk;
   13543           0 :     return true;
   13544             :   } while (false);
   13545             : 
   13546           0 :   SkipUntil(')');
   13547           0 :   mUnitlessLengthQuirk = oldUnitlessLengthQuirk;
   13548           0 :   return false;
   13549             : }
   13550             : 
   13551             : // We optimize away the <value-expression> production given that
   13552             : // ParseVariant consumes initial whitespace and we call
   13553             : // ExpectSymbol(')') with true for aSkipWS.
   13554             : //  * If aVariantMask is VARIANT_NUMBER, this function parses the
   13555             : //    <number-additive-expression> production.
   13556             : //  * If aVariantMask does not contain VARIANT_NUMBER, this function
   13557             : //    parses the <value-additive-expression> production.
   13558             : //  * Otherwise (VARIANT_NUMBER and other bits) this function parses
   13559             : //    whichever one of the productions matches ***and modifies
   13560             : //    aVariantMask*** to reflect which one it has parsed by either
   13561             : //    removing VARIANT_NUMBER or removing all other bits.
   13562             : // It does so iteratively, but builds the correct recursive
   13563             : // data structure.
   13564             : bool
   13565           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseCalcAdditiveExpression(nsCSSValue& aValue,
   13566             :                                            uint32_t& aVariantMask)
   13567             : {
   13568             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aVariantMask != 0, "unexpected variant mask");
   13569           0 :   nsCSSValue *storage = &aValue;
   13570             :   for (;;) {
   13571             :     bool haveWS;
   13572           0 :     if (!ParseCalcMultiplicativeExpression(*storage, aVariantMask, &haveWS))
   13573           0 :       return false;
   13574             : 
   13575           0 :     if (!haveWS || !GetToken(false))
   13576             :       return true;
   13577             :     nsCSSUnit unit;
   13578           0 :     if (mToken.IsSymbol('+')) {
   13579             :       unit = eCSSUnit_Calc_Plus;
   13580           0 :     } else if (mToken.IsSymbol('-')) {
   13581             :       unit = eCSSUnit_Calc_Minus;
   13582             :     } else {
   13583             :       UngetToken();
   13584           0 :       return true;
   13585             :     }
   13586           0 :     if (!RequireWhitespace())
   13587             :       return false;
   13588             : 
   13589           0 :     RefPtr<nsCSSValue::Array> arr = nsCSSValue::Array::Create(2);
   13590           0 :     arr->Item(0) = aValue;
   13591           0 :     storage = &arr->Item(1);
   13592           0 :     aValue.SetArrayValue(arr, unit);
   13593           0 :   }
   13594             : }
   13595             : 
   13596             : //  * If aVariantMask is VARIANT_NUMBER, this function parses the
   13597             : //    <number-multiplicative-expression> production.
   13598             : //  * If aVariantMask does not contain VARIANT_NUMBER, this function
   13599             : //    parses the <value-multiplicative-expression> production.
   13600             : //  * Otherwise (VARIANT_NUMBER and other bits) this function parses
   13601             : //    whichever one of the productions matches ***and modifies
   13602             : //    aVariantMask*** to reflect which one it has parsed by either
   13603             : //    removing VARIANT_NUMBER or removing all other bits.
   13604             : // It does so iteratively, but builds the correct recursive data
   13605             : // structure.
   13606             : // This function always consumes *trailing* whitespace when it returns
   13607             : // true; whether there was any such whitespace is returned in the
   13608             : // aHadFinalWS parameter.
   13609             : bool
   13610           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseCalcMultiplicativeExpression(nsCSSValue& aValue,
   13611             :                                                  uint32_t& aVariantMask,
   13612             :                                                  bool *aHadFinalWS)
   13613             : {
   13614             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aVariantMask != 0, "unexpected variant mask");
   13615           0 :   bool gotValue = false; // already got the part with the unit
   13616           0 :   bool afterDivision = false;
   13617             : 
   13618           0 :   nsCSSValue *storage = &aValue;
   13619             :   for (;;) {
   13620             :     uint32_t variantMask;
   13621           0 :     if (aVariantMask & VARIANT_INTEGER) {
   13622             :       MOZ_ASSERT(aVariantMask == VARIANT_INTEGER,
   13623             :                  "integers in calc expressions can't be mixed with anything "
   13624             :                  "else.");
   13625           0 :       variantMask = aVariantMask;
   13626           0 :     } else if (afterDivision || gotValue) {
   13627             :       // At this point in the calc expression, we expect a coefficient or a
   13628             :       // divisor, which must be a number. (Not a length/%/etc.)
   13629           0 :       variantMask = VARIANT_NUMBER;
   13630             :     } else {
   13631             :       // At this point in the calc expression, we'll accept a coefficient
   13632             :       // (a number) or a value of whatever type |aVariantMask| specifies.
   13633           0 :       variantMask = aVariantMask | VARIANT_NUMBER;
   13634             :     }
   13635           0 :     if (!ParseCalcTerm(*storage, variantMask))
   13636           0 :       return false;
   13637             :     MOZ_ASSERT(variantMask != 0,
   13638             :                "ParseCalcTerm did not set variantMask appropriately");
   13639             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!(variantMask & VARIANT_NUMBER) ||
   13640             :                !(variantMask & ~int32_t(VARIANT_NUMBER)),
   13641             :                "ParseCalcTerm did not set variantMask appropriately");
   13642             : 
   13643           0 :     if (variantMask & VARIANT_NUMBER) {
   13644             :       // Simplify the value immediately so we can check for division by
   13645             :       // zero.
   13646             :       mozilla::css::ReduceNumberCalcOps ops;

   13648           0 :       if (number == 0.0 && afterDivision)

   13651             :     } else {
   13652           0 :       gotValue = true;
   13653             : 
   13654           0 :       if (storage != &aValue) {
   13655             :         // Simplify any numbers in the Times_L position (which are
   13656             :         // not simplified by the check above).
   13657             :         MOZ_ASSERT(storage == &aValue.GetArrayValue()->Item(1),

   13659           0 :         nsCSSValue &leftValue = aValue.GetArrayValue()->Item(0);
   13660           0 :         if (variantMask & VARIANT_INTEGER) {
   13661             :           mozilla::css::ReduceIntegerCalcOps ops;
   13662           0 :           int integer = mozilla::css::ComputeCalc(leftValue, ops);
   13663           0 :           leftValue.SetIntValue(integer, eCSSUnit_Integer);
   13664             :         } else {
   13665             :           mozilla::css::ReduceNumberCalcOps ops;
   13666           0 :           float number = mozilla::css::ComputeCalc(leftValue, ops);
   13667           0 :           leftValue.SetFloatValue(number, eCSSUnit_Number);
   13668             :         }

   13670             :     }
   13671             : 
   13672           0 :     bool hadWS = RequireWhitespace();
   13673           0 :     if (!GetToken(false)) {
   13674           0 :       *aHadFinalWS = hadWS;
   13675           0 :       break;
   13676             :     }
   13677             :     nsCSSUnit unit;
   13678           0 :     if (mToken.IsSymbol('*')) {
   13679           0 :       unit = gotValue ? eCSSUnit_Calc_Times_R : eCSSUnit_Calc_Times_L;
   13680           0 :       afterDivision = false;
   13681           0 :     } else if (mToken.IsSymbol('/')) {
   13682           0 :       if (variantMask & VARIANT_INTEGER) {
   13683             :         // Integers aren't mixed with anything else (see the assert at the top
   13684             :         // of CSSParserImpl::ParseCalc).
   13685             :         // We don't allow division at all in calc()s for expressions where an
   13686             :         // integer is expected, because calc() division can't be resolved to
   13687             :         // an integer, as implied by spec text about '/' here:
   13688             :         // https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values-3/#calc-type-checking
   13689             :         // We've consumed the '/' token, but it doesn't matter as we're in an
   13690             :         // error-handling situation where we've already consumed a lot of
   13691             :         // other tokens (e.g. the token before the '/'). ParseVariant will
   13692             :         // indicate this with CSSParseResult::Error.
   13693             :         return false;
   13694             :       }
   13695             :       unit = eCSSUnit_Calc_Divided;
   13696             :       afterDivision = true;
   13697             :     } else {
   13698             :       UngetToken();
   13699           0 :       *aHadFinalWS = hadWS;
   13700           0 :       break;
   13701             :     }
   13702             : 
   13703           0 :     RefPtr<nsCSSValue::Array> arr = nsCSSValue::Array::Create(2);
   13704           0 :     arr->Item(0) = aValue;
   13705           0 :     storage = &arr->Item(1);
   13706           0 :     aValue.SetArrayValue(arr, unit);
   13707           0 :   }
   13708             : 
   13709             :   // Adjust aVariantMask (see comments above function) to reflect which
   13710             :   // option we took.
   13711           0 :   if (aVariantMask & VARIANT_NUMBER) {
   13712           0 :     if (gotValue) {
   13713           0 :       aVariantMask &= ~int32_t(VARIANT_NUMBER);
   13714             :     } else {
   13715           0 :       aVariantMask = VARIANT_NUMBER;
   13716             :     }
   13717             :   } else {
   13718           0 :     if (!gotValue) {
   13719             :       // We had to find a value, but we didn't.
   13720             :       return false;
   13721             :     }
   13722             :   }
   13723             : 
   13724             :   return true;
   13725             : }
   13726             : 
   13727             : //  * If aVariantMask is VARIANT_NUMBER, this function parses the
   13728             : //    <number-term> production.
   13729             : //  * If aVariantMask does not contain VARIANT_NUMBER, this function
   13730             : //    parses the <value-term> production.
   13731             : //  * Otherwise (VARIANT_NUMBER and other bits) this function parses
   13732             : //    whichever one of the productions matches ***and modifies
   13733             : //    aVariantMask*** to reflect which one it has parsed by either
   13734             : //    removing VARIANT_NUMBER or removing all other bits.
   13735             : bool
   13736           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseCalcTerm(nsCSSValue& aValue, uint32_t& aVariantMask)
   13737             : {
   13738             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aVariantMask != 0, "unexpected variant mask");
   13739           0 :   if (!GetToken(true))
   13740             :     return false;
   13741             :   // Either an additive expression in parentheses...

   13744           0 :       IsCSSTokenCalcFunction(mToken)) {

   13746           0 :         !ExpectSymbol(')', true)) {

   14190             : bool
   14191           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseFontSynthesis(nsCSSValue& aValue)

   14208           0 :   int32_t intValue = aValue.GetIntValue();
   14209             :   nsCSSValue nextValue;
   14210             : 
   14211           0 :   if (ParseEnum(nextValue, nsCSSProps::kFontSynthesisKTable)) {
   14212           0 :     int32_t nextIntValue = nextValue.GetIntValue();
   14213           0 :     if (nextIntValue & intValue) {
   14214             :       return false;
   14215             :     }
   14216           0 :     aValue.SetIntValue(nextIntValue | intValue, eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   14217             :   }
   14218             : 
   14219             :   return true;
   14220             : }
   14221             : 
   14222             : // font-variant-alternates allows for a combination of multiple
   14223             : // simple enumerated values and functional values.  Functional values have
   14224             : // parameter lists with one or more idents which are later resolved
   14225             : // based on values defined in @font-feature-value rules.
   14226             : //
   14227             : // font-variant-alternates: swash(flowing) historical-forms styleset(alt-g, alt-m);
   14228             : //
   14229             : // So for this the nsCSSValue is set to a pair value, with one
   14230             : // value for a bitmask of both simple and functional property values
   14231             : // and another value containing a ValuePairList with lists of idents
   14232             : // for each functional property value.
   14233             : //
   14234             : // pairValue
   14235             : //   o intValue
   14236             : //       NS_FONT_VARIANT_ALTERNATES_SWASH |
   14237             : //       NS_FONT_VARIANT_ALTERNATES_STYLESET
   14238             : //   o valuePairList, each element with
   14239             : //     - intValue - indicates which alternate
   14240             : //     - string or valueList of strings
   14241             : //
   14242             : // Note: when only 'historical-forms' is specified, there are no
   14243             : // functional values to store, in which case the valuePairList is a
   14244             : // single element dummy list.  In all other cases, the length of the
   14245             : // list will match the number of functional values.
   14246             : 
   14247             : #define MAX_ALLOWED_FEATURES 512
   14248             : 
   14249             : static uint16_t
   14250           0 : MaxElementsForAlternateType(nsCSSKeyword keyword)
   14251             : {
   14252           0 :   uint16_t maxElems = 1;
   14253           0 :   if (keyword == eCSSKeyword_styleset ||
   14254           0 :       keyword == eCSSKeyword_character_variant) {
   14255           0 :     maxElems = MAX_ALLOWED_FEATURES;
   14256             :   }
   14257           0 :   return maxElems;
   14258             : }
   14259             : 
   14260             : bool
   14261           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseSingleAlternate(int32_t& aWhichFeature,
   14262             :                                     nsCSSValue& aValue)
   14263             : {
   14264           0 :   if (!GetToken(true)) {
   14265             :     return false;
   14266             :   }
   14267             : 
   14268           0 :   bool isIdent = (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Ident);
   14269           0 :   if (mToken.mType != eCSSToken_Function && !isIdent) {
   14270             :     UngetToken();
   14271           0 :     return false;
   14272             :   }
   14273             : 
   14274             :   // ident ==> simple enumerated prop val (e.g. historical-forms)

   14276             :

   14280             :                                 nsCSSProps::kFontVariantAlternatesKTable :

   14288             :

   14349             : bool
   14350           0 : CSSParserImpl::MergeBitmaskValue(int32_t aNewValue,
   14351             :                                  const int32_t aMasks[],
   14352             :                                  int32_t& aMergedValue)
   14353             : {
   14354             :   // check to make sure value not already set
   14355           0 :   if (aNewValue & aMergedValue) {
   14356             :     return false;
   14357             :   }
   14358             : 
   14359             :   const int32_t *m = aMasks;

   14361             : 
   14362           0 :   while (*m != MASK_END_VALUE) {
   14363           0 :     if (*m & aNewValue) {
   14364           0 :       c = aMergedValue & *m;
   14365             :       break;
   14366             :     }
   14367           0 :     m++;
   14368             :   }
   14369             : 
   14370           0 :   if (c) {
   14371             :     return false;
   14372             :   }
   14373             : 
   14374           0 :   aMergedValue |= aNewValue;
   14375             :   return true;
   14376             : }
   14377             : 
   14378             : // aMasks - array of masks for mutually-exclusive property values,
   14379             : //          e.g. proportial-nums, tabular-nums
   14380             : 
   14381             : bool

   14710             : bool
   14711          15 : CSSParserImpl::ParseOneFamily(nsAString& aFamily,
   14712             :                               bool& aOneKeyword,
   14713             :                               bool& aQuoted)
   14714             : {
   14715          15 :   if (!GetToken(true))
   14716             :     return false;
   14717             : 
   14718          15 :   nsCSSToken* tk = &mToken;
   14719             : 
   14720          15 :   aOneKeyword = false;
   14721          15 :   aQuoted = false;
   14722          15 :   if (eCSSToken_Ident == tk->mType) {
   14723          15 :     aOneKeyword = true;
   14724          15 :     aFamily.Append(tk->mIdent);
   14725             :     for (;;) {
   14726          15 :       if (!GetToken(false))
   14727             :         break;
   14728             : 
   14729          15 :       if (eCSSToken_Ident == tk->mType) {
   14730           0 :         aOneKeyword = false;
   14731             :         // We had at least another keyword before.
   14732             :         // "If a sequence of identifiers is given as a font family name,
   14733             :         //  the computed value is the name converted to a string by joining
   14734             :         //  all the identifiers in the sequence by single spaces."
   14735             :         // -- CSS 2.1, section 15.3
   14736             :         // Whitespace tokens do not actually matter,
   14737             :         // identifier tokens can be separated by comments.
   14738           0 :         aFamily.Append(char16_t(' '));
   14739           0 :         aFamily.Append(tk->mIdent);

   14996           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParseFontRanges(nsCSSValue& aValue)
   14997             : {
   14998             :   InfallibleTArray<uint32_t> ranges;
   14999             :   for (;;) {
   15000           0 :     if (!GetToken(true))
   15001             :       break;
   15002             : 
   15003           0 :     if (mToken.mType != eCSSToken_URange) {
   15004             :       UngetToken();
   15005             :       break;
   15006             :     }
   15007             : 
   15008             :     // An invalid range token is a parsing error, causing the entire
   15009             :     // descriptor to be ignored.
   15010           0 :     if (!mToken.mIntegerValid)
   15011           0 :       return false;
   15012             : 
   15013           0 :     uint32_t low = mToken.mInteger;
   15014           0 :     uint32_t high = mToken.mInteger2;
   15015             : 
   15016             :     // A range that descends, or a range that is entirely outside the
   15017             :     // current range of Unicode (U+0-10FFFF) is ignored, but does not
   15018             :     // invalidate the descriptor.  A range that straddles the high end
   15019             :     // is clipped.
   15020           0 :     if (low <= 0x10FFFF && low <= high) {
   15021           0 :       if (high > 0x10FFFF)
   15022           0 :         high = 0x10FFFF;
   15023             : 
   15024           0 :       ranges.AppendElement(low);
   15025           0 :       ranges.AppendElement(high);
   15026             :     }
   15027           0 :     if (!ExpectSymbol(',', true))
   15028             :       break;
   15029           0 :   }
   15030             : 
   15031           0 :   if (ranges.Length() == 0)
   15032             :     return false;
   15033             : 
   15034             :   RefPtr<nsCSSValue::Array> srcVals
   15035           0 :     = nsCSSValue::Array::Create(ranges.Length());
   15036             : 
   15037           0 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < ranges.Length(); i++)
   15038           0 :     srcVals->Item(i).SetIntValue(ranges[i], eCSSUnit_Integer);

   15177             : bool
   15178           5 : CSSParserImpl::ParseListStyle()
   15179             : {
   15180             :   // 'list-style' can accept 'none' for two different subproperties,
   15181             :   // 'list-style-type' and 'list-style-image'.  In order to accept
   15182             :   // 'none' as the value of either but still allow another value for
   15183             :   // either, we need to ensure that the first 'none' we find gets
   15184             :   // allocated to a dummy property instead. Since parse function for
   15185             :   // 'list-style-type' could accept values for 'list-style-position',
   15186             :   // we put position in front of type.
   15187             :   static const nsCSSPropertyID listStyleIDs[] = {
   15188             :     eCSSPropertyExtra_x_none_value,
   15189             :     eCSSProperty_list_style_position,
   15190             :     eCSSProperty_list_style_type,
   15191             :     eCSSProperty_list_style_image
   15192             :   };
   15193             : 
   15194          25 :   nsCSSValue values[MOZ_ARRAY_LENGTH(listStyleIDs)];
   15195             :   int32_t found =
   15196           5 :     ParseChoice(values, listStyleIDs, ArrayLength(listStyleIDs));
   15197           5 :   if (found < 1) {
   15198             :     return false;
   15199             :   }
   15200             : 
   15201           5 :   if ((found & (1|4|8)) == (1|4|8)) {
   15202           0 :     if (values[0].GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_None) {
   15203             :       // We found a 'none' plus another value for both of
   15204             :       // 'list-style-type' and 'list-style-image'.  This is a parse
   15205             :       // error, since the 'none' has to count for at least one of them.
   15206             :       return false;
   15207             :     } else {
   15208             :       NS_ASSERTION(found == (1|2|4|8) && values[0] == values[1] &&
   15209             :                    values[0] == values[2] && values[0] == values[3],
   15210             :                    "should be a special value");
   15211             :     }
   15212             :   }
   15213             : 
   15214           5 :   if ((found & 2) == 0) {
   15215             :     values[1].SetIntValue(NS_STYLE_LIST_STYLE_POSITION_OUTSIDE,
   15216           0 :                           eCSSUnit_Enumerated);
   15217             :   }
   15218           5 :   if ((found & 4) == 0) {
   15219             :     // Provide default values
   15220           0 :     nsString type = (found & 1) ?
   15221           0 :       NS_LITERAL_STRING("none") : NS_LITERAL_STRING("disc");
   15222           0 :     values[2].SetStringValue(type, eCSSUnit_Ident);
   15223             :   }
   15224           5 :   if ((found & 8) == 0) {
   15225           5 :     values[3].SetNoneValue();

   15711             : 
   15712             : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////
   15713             : // transform Parsing Implementation
   15714             : 
   15715             : /* Reads a function list of arguments and consumes the closing parenthesis.
   15716             :  * Do not call this function directly; it's meant to be called from
   15717             :  * ParseFunction.
   15718             :  */
   15719             : bool
   15720          10 : CSSParserImpl::ParseFunctionInternals(const uint32_t aVariantMask[],
   15721             :                                       uint32_t aVariantMaskAll,
   15722             :                                       uint16_t aMinElems,
   15723             :                                       uint16_t aMaxElems,
   15724             :                                       InfallibleTArray<nsCSSValue> &aOutput)
   15725             : {
   15726             :   NS_ASSERTION((aVariantMask && !aVariantMaskAll) ||
   15727             :                (!aVariantMask && aVariantMaskAll),
   15728             :                "only one of the two variant mask parameters can be set");
   15729             : 
   15730          10 :   for (uint16_t index = 0; index < aMaxElems; ++index) {
   15731             :     nsCSSValue newValue;
   15732          10 :     uint32_t m = aVariantMaskAll ? aVariantMaskAll : aVariantMask[index];
   15733          10 :     if (ParseVariant(newValue, m, nullptr) != CSSParseResult::Ok) {
   15734             :       break;
   15735             :     }
   15736             : 
   15737          20 :     if (nsCSSValue::IsFloatUnit(newValue.GetUnit())) {
   15738             :       // Clamp infinity or -infinity values to max float or -max float to avoid
   15739             :       // calculations with infinity.
   15740             :       newValue.SetFloatValue(
   15741          10 :         mozilla::clamped(newValue.GetFloatValue(),
   15742             :                          -std::numeric_limits<float>::max(),
   15743          30 :                           std::numeric_limits<float>::max()),
   15744          20 :         newValue.GetUnit());
   15745             :     }
   15746             : 
   15747          10 :     aOutput.AppendElement(newValue);
   15748             : 
   15749          10 :     if (ExpectSymbol(',', true)) {
   15750             :       // Move on to the next argument if we see a comma.
   15751             :       continue;
   15752             :     }
   15753             : 
   15754          10 :     if (ExpectSymbol(')', true)) {
   15755             :       // Make sure we've read enough symbols if we see a closing parenthesis.
   15756          10 :       return (index + 1) >= aMinElems;
   15757             :     }
   15758             : 
   15759             :     // Only a comma or a closing parenthesis is valid after an argument.
   15760             :     break;
   15761             :   }
   15762             : 
   15763             :   // If we're here, we've hit an error without seeing a closing parenthesis or
   15764             :   // we've read too many elements without seeing a closing parenthesis.
   15765           0 :   SkipUntil(')');
   15766           0 :   return false;
   15767             : }
   15768             : 
   15769             : /* Parses a function [ input of the form (a [, b]*) ] and stores it
   15770             :  * as an nsCSSValue that holds a function of the form
   15771             :  * function-name arg1 arg2 ... argN
   15772             :  *
   15773             :  * On error, the return value is false.
   15774             :  *
   15775             :  * @param aFunction The name of the function that we're reading.
   15776             :  * @param aAllowedTypes An array of values corresponding to the legal
   15777             :  *        types for each element in the function.  The zeroth element in the
   15778             :  *        array corresponds to the first function parameter, etc.  The length
   15779             :  *        of this array _must_ be greater than or equal to aMaxElems or the
   15780             :  *        behavior is undefined.  If not null, aAllowTypesAll must be 0.
   15781             :  * @param aAllowedTypesAll If set, every element tested for these types
   15782             :  * @param aMinElems Minimum number of elements to read.  Reading fewer than
   15783             :  *        this many elements will result in the function failing.
   15784             :  * @param aMaxElems Maximum number of elements to read.  Reading more than
   15785             :  *        this many elements will result in the function failing.
   15786             :  * @param aValue (out) The value that was parsed.
   15787             :  */
   15788             : bool
   15789          10 : CSSParserImpl::ParseFunction(nsCSSKeyword aFunction,
   15790             :                              const uint32_t aAllowedTypes[],

   15796             :                (!aAllowedTypes && aAllowedTypesAll),

   15798             :   typedef InfallibleTArray<nsCSSValue>::size_type arrlen_t;
   15799             : 
   15800             :   /* 2^16 - 2, so that if we have 2^16 - 2 transforms, we have 2^16 - 1
   15801             :    * elements stored in the the nsCSSValue::Array.
   15802             :    */
   15803             :   static const arrlen_t MAX_ALLOWED_ELEMS = 0xFFFE;

   15808             :    * We reserve 16 entries in the foundValues array in order to avoid
   15809             :    * having to resize the array dynamically when parsing some well-formed

   15811             :    * matrix3d() accepts.

   15835             : /**

   16854             : CSSParserImpl::ParseAnimationOrTransitionShorthandResult
   16855           5 : CSSParserImpl::ParseAnimationOrTransitionShorthand(
   16856             :                  const nsCSSPropertyID* aProperties,
   16857             :                  const nsCSSValue* aInitialValues,
   16858             :                  nsCSSValue* aValues,
   16859             :                  size_t aNumProperties)
   16860             : {
   16861             :   nsCSSValue tempValue;
   16862             :   // first see if 'inherit', 'initial' or 'unset' is specified.  If one is,
   16863             :   // it can be the only thing specified, so don't attempt to parse any
   16864             :   // additional properties

   16866           0 :     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < aNumProperties; ++i) {
   16867           0 :       AppendValue(aProperties[i], tempValue);
   16868             :     }
   16869             :     return eParseAnimationOrTransitionShorthand_Inherit;
   16870             :   }
   16871             : 
   16872             :   static const size_t maxNumProperties = 8;
   16873             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aNumProperties <= maxNumProperties,
   16874             :              "can't handle this many properties");
   16875             :   nsCSSValueList *cur[maxNumProperties];
   16876             :   bool parsedProperty[maxNumProperties];
   16877             : 
   16878          20 :   for (size_t i = 0; i < aNumProperties; ++i) {
   16879          20 :     cur[i] = nullptr;
   16880             :   }
   16881             :   bool atEOP = false; // at end of property?
   16882             :   for (;;) { // loop over comma-separated transitions or animations
   16883             :     // whether a particular subproperty was specified for this
   16884             :     // transition or animation
   16885          10 :     bool haveAnyProperty = false;
   16886          50 :     for (size_t i = 0; i < aNumProperties; ++i) {
   16887          40 :       parsedProperty[i] = false;
   16888             :     }
   16889             :     for (;;) { // loop over values within a transition or animation
   16890          30 :       bool foundProperty = false;
   16891             :       // check to see if we're at the end of one full transition or
   16892             :       // animation definition (either because we hit a comma or because
   16893             :       // we hit the end of the property definition)
   16894          30 :       if (ExpectSymbol(',', true))
   16895             :         break;
   16896          25 :       if (CheckEndProperty()) {
   16897             :         atEOP = true;
   16898             :         break;
   16899             :       }
   16900             : 
   16901             :       // else, try to parse the next transition or animation sub-property
   16902          30 :       for (uint32_t i = 0; !foundProperty && i < aNumProperties; ++i) {
   16903          50 :         if (!parsedProperty[i]) {
   16904             :           // if we haven't found this property yet, try to parse it
   16905             :           CSSParseResult result =
   16906          50 :             ParseSingleValueProperty(tempValue, aProperties[i]);
   16907          50 :           if (result == CSSParseResult::Error) {
   16908             :             return eParseAnimationOrTransitionShorthand_Error;
   16909             :           }
   16910          50 :           if (result == CSSParseResult::Ok) {
   16911          20 :             parsedProperty[i] = true;
   16912          20 :             cur[i] = AppendValueToList(aValues[i], cur[i], tempValue);
   16913          20 :             foundProperty = true;
   16914          20 :             haveAnyProperty = true;
   16915          20 :             break; // out of inner loop; continue looking for next sub-property
   16916             :           }
   16917             :         }
   16918             :       }
   16919          20 :       if (!foundProperty) {

   16921             :         // parse any of the sub-properties, so the declaration is invalid.
   16922             :         return eParseAnimationOrTransitionShorthand_Error;
   16923             :       }
   16924             :     }
   16925             : 
   16926          10 :     if (!haveAnyProperty) {
   16927             :       // Got an empty item.
   16928             :       return eParseAnimationOrTransitionShorthand_Error;
   16929             :     }

   16931             :     // We hit the end of the property or the end of one transition
   16932             :     // or animation definition, add its components to the list.

   16949             : bool
   16950           5 : CSSParserImpl::ParseTransition()
   16951             : {
   16952             :   static const nsCSSPropertyID kTransitionProperties[] = {
   16953             :     eCSSProperty_transition_duration,
   16954             :     eCSSProperty_transition_timing_function,
   16955             :     // Must check 'transition-delay' after 'transition-duration', since
   16956             :     // that's our assumption about what the spec means for the shorthand
   16957             :     // syntax (the first time given is the duration, and the second
   16958             :     // given is the delay).

   17307           0 : CSSParserImpl::ParsePaintOrder()

   17570             : 
   17571             : bool
   17572           5 : CSSParserImpl::ParseValueWithVariables(CSSVariableDeclarations::Type* aType,
   17573             :                                        bool* aDropBackslash,
   17574             :                                        nsString& aImpliedCharacters,
   17575             :                                        void (*aFunc)(const nsAString&, void*),
   17576             :                                        void* aData)
   17577             : {
   17578             :   // A property value is invalid if it contains variable references and also:
   17579             :   //
   17580             :   //   * has unbalanced parens, brackets or braces
   17581             :   //   * has any BAD_STRING or BAD_URL tokens
   17582             :   //   * has any ';' or '!' tokens at the top level of a variable reference's
   17583             :   //     fallback
   17584             :   //
   17585             :   // If the property is a custom property (i.e. a variable declaration), then
   17586             :   // it is also invalid if it consists of no tokens, such as:
   17587             :   //
   17588             :   //   --invalid:;
   17589             :   //
   17590             :   // Note that is valid for a custom property to have a value that consists
   17591             :   // solely of white space, such as:
   17592             :   //
   17593             :   //   --valid: ;
   17594             : 
   17595             :   // Stack of closing characters for currently open constructs.
   17596           5 :   StopSymbolCharStack stack;
   17597             : 
   17598             :   // Indexes into ')' characters in |stack| that correspond to "var(".  This
   17599             :   // is used to stop parsing when we encounter a '!' or ';' at the top level
   17600             :   // of a variable reference's fallback.
   17601           5 :   AutoTArray<uint32_t, 16> references;
   17602             : 
   17603           5 :   if (!GetToken(false)) {
   17604             :     // Variable value was empty since we reached EOF.
   17605           0 :     REPORT_UNEXPECTED_EOF(PEVariableEOF);
   17606           0 :     return false;
   17607             :   }
   17608             : 
   17609          10 :   if (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Symbol &&
   17610           0 :       (mToken.mSymbol == '!' ||
   17611           0 :        mToken.mSymbol == ')' ||
   17612           0 :        mToken.mSymbol == ';' ||
   17613           0 :        mToken.mSymbol == ']' ||
   17614             :        mToken.mSymbol == '}')) {
   17615             :     // Variable value was empty since we reached the end of the construct.
   17616             :     UngetToken();
   17617           0 :     REPORT_UNEXPECTED_TOKEN(PEVariableEmpty);
   17618             :     return false;
   17619             :   }
   17620             : 
   17621           5 :   if (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Whitespace) {
   17622           5 :     if (!GetToken(true)) {
   17623             :       // Variable value was white space only.  This is valid.
   17624             :       MOZ_ASSERT(!BackslashDropped());
   17625           0 :       *aType = CSSVariableDeclarations::eTokenStream;
   17626           0 :       *aDropBackslash = false;
   17627           0 :       AppendImpliedEOFCharacters(aImpliedCharacters);
   17628           0 :       return true;
   17629             :     }
   17630             :   }
   17631             : 
   17632             :   // Look for 'initial', 'inherit' or 'unset' as the first non-white space
   17633             :   // token.
   17634           5 :   CSSVariableDeclarations::Type type = CSSVariableDeclarations::eTokenStream;
   17635           5 :   if (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Ident) {
   17636           0 :     if (mToken.mIdent.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("initial")) {
   17637             :       type = CSSVariableDeclarations::eInitial;
   17638           0 :     } else if (mToken.mIdent.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("inherit")) {
   17639             :       type = CSSVariableDeclarations::eInherit;
   17640           0 :     } else if (mToken.mIdent.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("unset")) {
   17641           0 :       type = CSSVariableDeclarations::eUnset;
   17642             :     }
   17643             :   }
   17644             : 
   17645           5 :   if (type != CSSVariableDeclarations::eTokenStream) {
   17646           0 :     if (!GetToken(true)) {
   17647             :       // Variable value was 'initial' or 'inherit' followed by EOF.
   17648             :       MOZ_ASSERT(!BackslashDropped());
   17649           0 :       *aType = type;
   17650           0 :       *aDropBackslash = false;
   17651           0 :       AppendImpliedEOFCharacters(aImpliedCharacters);
   17652           0 :       return true;
   17653             :     }
   17654             :     UngetToken();
   17655           0 :     if (mToken.mType == eCSSToken_Symbol &&
   17656           0 :         (mToken.mSymbol == '!' ||
   17657           0 :          mToken.mSymbol == ')' ||
   17658           0 :          mToken.mSymbol == ';' ||
   17659           0 :          mToken.mSymbol == ']' ||
   17660             :          mToken.mSymbol == '}')) {
   17661             :       // Variable value was 'initial' or 'inherit' followed by the end
   17662             :       // of the declaration.
   17663             :       MOZ_ASSERT(!BackslashDropped());
   17664           0 :       *aType = type;
   17665           0 :       *aDropBackslash = false;
   17666           0 :       return true;
   17667             :     }
   17668             :   }
   17669             : 
   17670          10 :   do {
   17671          15 :     switch (mToken.mType) {
   17672             :       case eCSSToken_Symbol:
   17673           5 :         if (mToken.mSymbol == '(') {
   17674           0 :           stack.AppendElement(')');
   17675           5 :         } else if (mToken.mSymbol == '[') {
   17676           0 :           stack.AppendElement(']');
   17677           5 :         } else if (mToken.mSymbol == '{') {
   17678           0 :           stack.AppendElement('}');
   17679           5 :         } else if (mToken.mSymbol == ';' ||
   17680             :                    mToken.mSymbol == '!') {
   17681           5 :           if (stack.IsEmpty()) {
   17682             :             UngetToken();
   17683             :             MOZ_ASSERT(!BackslashDropped());
   17684           5 :             *aType = CSSVariableDeclarations::eTokenStream;
   17685           5 :             *aDropBackslash = false;
   17686           5 :             return true;
   17687           0 :           } else if (!references.IsEmpty() &&
   17688           0 :                      references.LastElement() == stack.Length() - 1) {
   17689           0 :             REPORT_UNEXPECTED_TOKEN(PEInvalidVariableTokenFallback);
   17690           0 :             SkipUntilAllOf(stack);
   17691           0 :             return false;
   17692             :           }
   17693           0 :         } else if (mToken.mSymbol == ')' ||
   17694           0 :                    mToken.mSymbol == ']' ||
   17695             :                    mToken.mSymbol == '}') {
   17696             :           for (;;) {
   17697           0 :             if (stack.IsEmpty()) {
   17698             :               UngetToken();
   17699             :               MOZ_ASSERT(!BackslashDropped());
   17700           0 :               *aType = CSSVariableDeclarations::eTokenStream;
   17701           0 :               *aDropBackslash = false;
   17702           0 :               return true;
   17703             :             }
   17704           0 :             char16_t c = stack.LastElement();
   17705           0 :             stack.TruncateLength(stack.Length() - 1);
   17706           0 :             if (!references.IsEmpty() &&
   17707           0 :                 references.LastElement() == stack.Length()) {
   17708           0 :               references.TruncateLength(references.Length() - 1);
   17709             :             }
   17710           0 :             if (mToken.mSymbol == c) {
   17711             :               break;
   17712             :             }
   17713             :           }
   17714             :         }
   17715             :         break;
   17716             : 
   17717             :       case eCSSToken_Function:
   17718           5 :         if (mToken.mIdent.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("var")) {
   17719           5 :           if (!GetToken(true)) {
   17720             :             // EOF directly after "var(".
   17721           0 :             REPORT_UNEXPECTED_EOF(PEExpectedVariableNameEOF);
   17722           0 :             return false;
   17723             :           }
   17724          10 :           if (mToken.mType != eCSSToken_Ident ||
   17725           5 :               !nsCSSProps::IsCustomPropertyName(mToken.mIdent)) {
   17726             :             // There must be an identifier directly after the "var(" and
   17727             :             // it must be a custom property name.
   17728             :             UngetToken();
   17729           0 :             REPORT_UNEXPECTED_TOKEN(PEExpectedVariableName);
   17730           0 :             SkipUntil(')');
   17731           0 :             SkipUntilAllOf(stack);
   17732           0 :             return false;
   17733             :           }
   17734           5 :           if (aFunc) {
   17735             :             MOZ_ASSERT(Substring(mToken.mIdent, 0,
   17736             :                                  CSS_CUSTOM_NAME_PREFIX_LENGTH).
   17737             :                          EqualsLiteral("--"));
   17738             :             // remove '--'
   17739             :             const nsDependentSubstring varName =
   17740           0 :               Substring(mToken.mIdent, CSS_CUSTOM_NAME_PREFIX_LENGTH);
   17741           0 :             aFunc(varName, aData);
   17742             :           }
   17743           5 :           if (!GetToken(true)) {
   17744             :             // EOF right after "var(<ident>".
   17745           0 :             stack.AppendElement(')');
   17746           5 :           } else if (mToken.IsSymbol(',')) {
   17747             :             // Variable reference with fallback.
   17748           0 :             if (!GetToken(false) || mToken.IsSymbol(')')) {
   17749             :               // Comma must be followed by at least one fallback token.
   17750           0 :               REPORT_UNEXPECTED(PEExpectedVariableFallback);
   17751           0 :               SkipUntilAllOf(stack);
   17752           0 :               return false;
   17753             :             }
   17754             :             UngetToken();
   17755           0 :             references.AppendElement(stack.Length());
   17756           0 :             stack.AppendElement(')');
   17757           5 :           } else if (mToken.IsSymbol(')')) {
   17758             :             // Correctly closed variable reference.
   17759             :           } else {
   17760             :             // Malformed variable reference.
   17761           0 :             REPORT_UNEXPECTED_TOKEN(PEExpectedVariableCommaOrCloseParen);
   17762           0 :             SkipUntil(')');
   17763           0 :             SkipUntilAllOf(stack);
   17764           0 :             return false;
   17765             :           }
   17766             :         } else {
   17767           0 :           stack.AppendElement(')');
   17768             :         }
   17769             :         break;
   17770             : 
   17771             :       case eCSSToken_Bad_String:
   17772           0 :         SkipUntilAllOf(stack);
   17773           0 :         return false;
   17774             : 
   17775             :       case eCSSToken_Bad_URL:
   17776           0 :         SkipUntil(')');
   17777           0 :         SkipUntilAllOf(stack);
   17778           0 :         return false;

   17808             :   // We normally would need to pass in a sheet principal to InitScanner,
   17809             :   // because we might parse a URL value.  However, we will never use the
   17810             :   // parsed nsCSSValue (and so whether we have a sheet principal or not

   17813             :   // that it's safe to skip the assertion.
